0.title: Tesla shares gain after Elon Musk puts $44 billion Twitter deal on hold
0.article_body: Shares of Tesla surged 4% on Friday after its CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk said he has temporarily put the $44 billion deal to acquire Twitter on hold. Tesla shares have lost about 25% of their value since Musk disclosed a stake in Twitter on April 4. Meanwhile, Twitter stock plunged 10% after Musk's announcement on Friday.

1.title: Try to learn a new shot every year: PBKS' Jitesh on his form in IPL 2022
1.article_body: Speaking on the secret of his success in his debut IPL season, PBKS wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma stated he tries to learn a new shot every year or learn something new. Jitesh has scored 162 runs in nine matches at a strike rate of over 160 in ongoing IPL. "I didn't expect that I would've a season like this," he added.

2.title: 3 J&K govt employees terminated over alleged terror links: Report
2.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) administration has terminated three state government employees, including a professor and a police constable, for their alleged links with terror groups, according to a report. Their termination was based on the recommendation of a designated committee in J&K, the report said. Reportedly, one of the terminated employees had crossed over to Pakistan for terror training.

3.title: Ranveer hosts 'Jayeshbhai...' screening for underprivileged kids
3.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh hosted a screening of his film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' for underprivileged children in Mumbai on Friday. Pictures show the actor cutting cake at the screening and dancing with the children. He said, "I will also choose important films like Jayeshbhai Jordaar that satirically talks about patriarchy and toxic masculinity...It is a film that had to be made."

4.title: Zomato's 10-minute food delivery initiative being re-evaluated: Report
4.article_body: Zomato's 10-minute food delivery service is being re-evaluated as the company was unable to meet time targets for all orders during its Gurugram pilot, Economic Times reported. Shortage of delivery fleet and intense heat wave are causing delivery delays of 15-20 minutes, the report stated. It further said that Zomato has halted plans to initiate 10-minute delivery services in Bengaluru.

5.title: Bus with Vaishno Devi pilgrims catches fire due to overheated tank in J&K, 4 killed
5.article_body: At least four people were killed and around 20 others were injured on Friday when a bus carrying pilgrims to Vaishno Devi caught on fire near Katra in Jammu and Kashmir, officials said. The fire was caused by an explosion in the bus tank due to overheating caused by the weather, Reasi Deputy Commissioner Babila Rakwal said.

6.title: People carrying reporter Shireen's coffin clash with Israeli police; video surfaces
6.article_body:
Israeli police clashed with Palestinian mourners carrying Al Jazeera reporter Shireen Abu Akleh's coffin at the start of her funeral procession in Jerusalem on Friday. A video showed the group carrying her coffin almost dropping the casket and saving it just before one end hit the ground. She 
was shot during an Israeli military raid in the West Bank.

7.title: Dhaakad has 14-min fight sequence, longest in Hindi films: Kangana
7.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, speaking about her upcoming film 'Dhaakad', said that the film has an approximately 14-minute long fight sequence, adding that it is the longest such sequence in Hindi cinema. The actress further said that the Indian film industry should be scared of the American film industry and should come together to save Indian screens from international films.

8.title: Rupinder ruled out of Asia Cup due to wrist injury, Lakra to lead India
8.article_body: Drag-flicker Rupinder Pal Singh has been ruled out of the Asia Cup Hockey, starting from May 23 in Jakarta, due to a wrist injury. Rupinder, who was named captain of the 20-member squad, sustained the injury during a training session. Defender Birendra Lakra will replace Rupinder as captain, while forward SV Sunil will step in as the vice-captain.

9.title: CoinSwitch delists LUNA as it crashes 100%, CEO says 'meltdown is rapid'
9.article_body: CoinSwitch Kuber CEO Ashish Singhal on Friday tweeted that the crypto exchange is delisting Terra's LUNA crypto token after it crashed nearly 100% in the last 24 hours. "The last few days have been tough for all of us...The meltdown of the Terra ecosystem and LUNA have been rapid and devastating," Singhal said, noting that it is "a tough decision".

10.title: BJP chief JP Nadda holds roadshow in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh
10.article_body: BJP President JP Nadda and CM Jairam Thakur held a roadshow in Himachal Pradesh on Friday. Addressing a gathering, Nadda said, "Under the guidance of PM Narendra Modi and CM Jairam Thakur, the people of Himachal Pradesh are eager to give their blessings to BJP again." Notably, Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh are likely to be held later this year.

11.title: Major fire in building near Delhi metro station, 24 tenders reach spot
11.article_body: A major fire broke out in a building near pillar number 544 at Delhi's Mundka metro station on Friday. As many as 24 fire tenders were rushed to the spot after Delhi Fire Services received information. "Cranes are being used to go up and douse the fire. There's no information on the rescue operation yet," DFS Chief Atul Garg said.

12.title: RCB to bowl first against PBKS, playing XIs announced
12.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis won the toss and elected to bowl first against PBKS in their IPL 2022 clash on Friday. RCB are fielding an unchanged side, while Harpreet Brar has replaced Sandeep Sharma in PBKS' playing XI. RCB are currently fourth on the points table with 14 points, while PBKS are on the eighth position with 10 points.

13.title: Will bulldoze if MCD doesn't act: AAP on encroachment at BJP leader's home
13.article_body: Senior AAP leader Durgesh Pathak on Friday claimed that the municipal corporations in the city were not taking any action against the alleged encroachments by BJP leaders and officials. "The AAP will bulldoze the unauthorised construction at [Delhi BJP chief] Adesh Gupta's residence and office...if the MCD fails to act against it by 11 am on Saturday," Pathak said.

14.title: He was a great statesman: PM Modi condoles demise of UAE's Prez
14.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday condoled the demise of United Arab Emirates' President Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan. "He was a great statesman and visionary leader under whom India-UAE relations prospered," PM Modi said. "The heartfelt condolences of the people of India are with the people of UAE. May his soul rest in peace," the PM added.

15.title: Indian Embassy to resume operation in Kyiv amid Russia-Ukraine war
15.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs on Friday announced that the Indian Embassy in Ukraine, which was temporarily operating out of Poland, would be resuming its operation in Ukrainian capital of Kyiv from May 17. The operation was shifted amid shelling in the city after Russia announced invasion of Ukraine in February.

16.title: Heartless section still calling tragedy of Kashmir a lie: Anupam
16.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher shared a video message on Friday, saying that "a section of heartless people" is still calling 'The Kashmir Files' a lie. He added that the film was a "tight slap" on the faces of those calling this "tragedy" a lie for over 32 years. Anupam also spoke about Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat who was shot dead recently.

17.title: My $2.8 mn is literally worth $1,000: YouTuber KSI after losing millions in LUNA crash
17.article_body: YouTuber KSI claimed he lost about $2.8 million after the cryptocurrency LUNA crashed. He revealed he had put $2.8 million in LUNA, but it plummeted to a new valuation of less than $1,000 in a day. Speaking about how previous losses made him depressed and seek therapy, KSI wrote about the recent loss, "But that's ok because I'm not dead."

18.title: Hindi speakers sell pani puris in Tamil Nadu: State minister amid language row
18.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy over the national language, Tamil Nadu Higher Education Minister K Ponmudy has said that Hindi speakers "sell pani puris" in Coimbatore. "We were told that learning Hindi would land us jobs. Did we get jobs?" said Ponmudy. This came after Home Minister Amit Shah said that people from different states should speak Hindi instead of English.

19.title: England's bold Test coach appointment of McCullum makes me nervous: Vaughan
19.article_body: After Brendon McCullum was named as head coach of England's Test team, Michael Vaughan said, "England's appointment of McCullum makes me nervous." He added, "He's taking over England at the right time. They are at their lowest ebb since the mid-1990s." Vaughan further said, "He will not have to do much for us all to see a massive improvement."

20.title: India to send delegations to 9 countries to discuss wheat exports
20.article_body: The Centre on Thursday said that it'll send trade delegations to Morocco, Tunisia, Indonesia, Philippines, Thailand, Vietnam, Turkey, Algeria and Lebanon to explore possibilities of boosting wheat exports from India. India has set a target of a record 10 million tonnes of wheat export in 2022-23, it added. This comes amid a rising demand for wheat due to Russia-Ukraine war.

21.title: 61.5 kg gold worth ₹32.5 crore seized at Delhi's Air Cargo Complex
21.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has seized 61.5 kilograms of gold concealed in triangle valves imported at the Air Cargo Complex in Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport. The seized gold has a market value of ₹32.5 crore and was found to be of 99% purity, the Finance Ministry said. The consignment had reportedly originated from China's Guangzhou.

22.title: Symbiosis to reinstate unvaccinated staffer who was asked to go on leave
22.article_body: Pune-based Symbiosis Society has told the Bombay High Court that it'll reinstate one of its unvaccinated employees who was asked to go on unpaid leave till he produced a vaccine certificate. We'll review the COVID-19 vaccination mandate for employees, it added. Subrata Mazumdar, who didn't get vaccinated amid health issues, had moved court after being asked to go on leave.

23.title: 260-yr-old gold coach to be part of UK Queen's 4-day Platinum Jubilee celebration
23.article_body: The British Royal Family has announced that the 260-year-old Gold State Coach will be part of Queen Elizabeth II's Platinum Jubilee celebration. "The...Coach transported The Queen to her Coronation 75 years ago, and hasn't been...on the streets of London for over 20 years," the Royal Family said. The celebration will see a four-day public holiday from June 2 in UK.

24.title: We identified Rohit as a possible captain for MI during IPL 2011: Pollock
24.article_body: Recalling how MI had already identified Rohit Sharma as a future captain of the franchise after he impressed with his form during IPL 2011, Shaun Pollock said the 35-year-old was very mature beyond his years in many ways. "He's been fantastic for the Mumbai franchise as Dhoni has been for CSK," he added. Rohit-led MI have won five titles.

25.title: Still committed to acquisition: Musk after putting $44 billion Twitter deal on hold
25.article_body: Elon Musk tweeted he's "still committed to acquisition" after he put on hold the $44 billion deal to take Twitter private. Musk has temporarily put the deal on hold while he awaits data supporting Twitter's claim that spam accounts comprise less than 5% of users. Twitter shares fell to their lowest level since Musk disclosed his stake after the announcement.

26.title: Govt raises ₹20,560 crore as India's biggest-ever IPO of LIC priced at ₹949
26.article_body: The government has raised ₹20,560 crore as India's biggest-ever IPO of Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) has been priced at the top of the range at ₹949. The IPO, through which the government is selling its 3.5% LIC stake, was oversubscribed 2.95 times on its final day of bidding. LIC is likely to list on the stock exchanges on May 17.

27.title: Vicky Kaushal was chillest groom, his aim was to party: Stylist
27.article_body: Amandeep Kaur, who was Vicky Kaushal's stylist for his wedding with Katrina Kaif, has called him the "chillest groom of all time", adding that his aim was to party and have a good time. "Vicky...on his wedding day...was truly happy...He was just so excited. I was just surprised at how beautifully, gracefully he went through the entire event," Amandeep added.

28.title: Tu hero ban jayega: Kartik Aaryan on advice to younger self
28.article_body: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' actors Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani were asked in an interview about what advice they would give to their younger selves. Kiara said, "I'd just say that it's all going to work out." Kartik added, "I'd frame it for both of us, 'Don't worry...Tu hero aur tu heroine ban jayegi' (You'll become hero and you'll become heroine)."

29.title: They've got to playoff hopes without Kohli's support: Vaughan on RCB
29.article_body: Discussing RCB's playoff possibilities in IPL 2022, Michael Vaughan said they have performed well so far in IPL 2022 despite Virat Kohli's significant contribution. "He averages under 20...if he can find form, with the likes of Faf du Plessis, Glenn Maxwell and co., this is such a dangerous team," he added. RCB are currently fourth on the points table.

30.title: 2 rowdy sheeters, 8 accomplices held for plotting robbery in B'luru
30.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru City Police has arrested two rowdy sheeters and their eight accomplices, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Friday. All 10 were arrested for plotting a robbery in the city, Gupta said. Police have seized lethal weapons and two cars from the accused's possession.

31.title: Plants grown in Moon soil for the first time, NASA shares pics
31.article_body: In a first, plants have successfully been grown in soil collected from the Moon's surface during the Apollo era, NASA said on Thursday while sharing pictures. Researchers at the University of Florida planted thale cress in lunar soil that was brought back by astronauts decades ago. The plants, however, grew slower, showed signs of stress and were also stunted.

32.title: Always listen to your wife: Pune Police chief tells Twitter user
32.article_body: Pune City Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta recently took to Twitter to answer citizens' questions about various law and order issues. When a user on the micro-blogging site told Gupta that he was in a dilemma about where he should relocate, the police chief said, "Always listen to your wife." "Everyone including me does the same," Gupta added.

33.title: Police bust gambling club in Delhi's Sadar Bazar, arrest 17 people
33.article_body: Delhi Police have busted a gambling club in the Sadar Bazar area and arrested 17 people who were indulging in the offence, DCP (North) Sagar Singh Kalsi said. According to police, they carried out a raid at a house after receiving a tip-off and subsequently found a gambling den being operated there. Police have recovered ₹26,620 cash from their possession.

34.title: 'Doorway' spotted on Mars in new image released by NASA
34.article_body: A newly released image by NASA, taken by Curiosity Rover, appears to show a "doorway" cut into the rock face on Mars. One social media user described the scene as "a formation on Mars which appears to be a portal and a wall nearby that looks artificial." There has been no official explanation from the American space agency about it.

35.title: Cong has given us a lot and it's time to pay it back: Sonia Gandhi
35.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi, while speaking at the party's Chintan Shivir in Udaipur, said changes in the organisation are the "need of the hour". "We need to change the way we work," she added. "We've to keep the organisation above personal ambitions as the party has given us a lot and it's time to pay it back," Gandhi further said.

36.title: They love it there: Sanjay Dutt on his family shifting to Dubai
36.article_body: Sanjay Dutt, talking about why his family chose to settle down in Dubai in 2020, said it wasn't a planned move. "It...happened on its own. Maanayata was doing...business in Dubai, it clicked and she went...and...kids went with her," he added. Sanjay said his 11-year-old twins Shahraan and Iqra "love it there", adding that they like their school and their activities.

37.title: Umran bowled at 157 kmph, he has something no one else has: Ian Bishop
37.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Ian Bishop said SRH pacer Umran Malik has something "no one" else in the world has, having bowled at a speed of 157 kmph in IPL 2022. "I think if he gets into the India squad, he may not have to play immediately," added Bishop. Ex-India opener Aakash Chopra stated that Umran is not ready to play for India.

38.title: Definitely at no. 6 or 7 in T20 WC: Gavaskar on Dinesh Karthik
38.article_body: Former India skipper Sunil Gavaskar has backed RCB batter Dinesh Karthik to play the role of a "finisher" for India in this year's ICC T20 World Cup. "The way the IPL is going for him at the moment...I would definitely look at him as a batter who can come in at no. 6 or no. 7," Gavaskar said.

39.title: Hyderabad Police seize 250 grams of marijuana, peddler arrested
39.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested a drug peddler and seized 250 grams of marijuana and hashish oil weighing 1,062 grams from him. The police said that they have also seized a two-wheeler from the accused. This comes days after the Cyberabad Police seized 800 kg of marijuana worth ₹2 crore and arrested two people.

40.title: We shot in a coal mine, our lungs were filled with soot: Kangana on Dhaakad
40.article_body: Kangana Ranaut recalled shooting action sequences for her upcoming movie 'Dhaakad', and said, "We shot in a coal mine and our lungs were filled with soot." "It was coming out of our nostrils," she added. "We shot internationally as well as locally in India. We shot in Singrauli, Madhya Pradesh. Our director shot in the harshest terrains," Kangana said.

41.title: He was shocked as it was clearly not out: Kaif on Rohit's dismissal vs KKR
41.article_body: Ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said MI captain Rohit Sharma was "shocked" following his dismissal for 2 in MI's loss against KKR. "Rohit was clearly not out," added Kaif. Kaif stated that Rohit's "poor form" having scored 218 runs in IPL 2022 so far is a "huge" talking point, adding it could prove "costly" for India in T20 World Cup 2022.

42.title: PBKS can win only if Mayank doesn't bat or scores a fifty: Chopra
42.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has made a prediction on the match between the Punjab Kings and the Royal Challengers Bangalore. "It won't be a bad idea (for PBKS) to bat first," Chopra said. "PBKS can only win if either Mayank Agarwal's batting doesn't come or...he scores a fifty. Otherwise, RCB are favourites to win this match," he added.

43.title: Nadal knocked out of Italian Open by 23-year-old Denis Shapovalov
43.article_body: Twenty one-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal was knocked out of the Italian Open after losing his 'Round of 16' match to Canada's Denis Shapovalov by 6-1, 5-7 and 2-6 on Thursday. The 16th-ranked Shapovalov handed the fourth-ranked Nadal his earliest tournament exit since 2008. "I am not injured. I am a player living with an injury," Nadal said.

44.title: Cigarette butt collection drive in B'luru to bolster public smoking rules
44.article_body: A cigarette and beedi butt collection campaign has been launched in Bengaluru to highlight the rampant smoking in public places. The campaign will culminate on May 31, when all the collected cigarettes' and beedis' butts will be displayed. Under the campaign, an MoU will also be submitted to get the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA) amendment bill passed.

45.title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.2 hits Arunachal Pradesh’s Changlang
45.article_body: An earthquake measuring 4.2 on the Richter Scale hit South Changlang in Arunachal Pradesh on Friday, according to National Center for Seismology (NCS). The quake struck at 12:39 pm, at a depth of 120 kilometres, the NCS said on Twitter. Earlier in the morning, NCS had tweeted that an earthquake of magnitude 3.5 hit Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala at 7:46 am.

46.title: Transgenders to get dedicated OPD at Pune's Sassoon hospital
46.article_body: Pune's Sassoon General Hospital will form an exclusive Out Patient Department (OPD) for transgenders, according to a letter from the hospital to NCP MP Vandana Chavan. "The transgender community faces several health issues. Due to financial constraints, most of them visit Sassoon hospital," Chavan said. "But, when they are at the OPD, they are being stared at," she added.

47.title: ISRO successfully carries out static test of Gaganyaan rocket's booster
47.article_body: Indian Space Research Organisation on Friday successfully completed the static test firing of solid fuel-powered rocket booster engine for its human space mission programme Gaganyaan. This booster engine is part of Geosynchronous Satellite Launch Vehicle Mark III (GSLV Mk III) rocket that will carry Indian astronauts to space. The test was conducted at Andhra Pradesh's Sriharikota,  ISRO tweeted.

48.title: Cash, silver worth ₹3.7 lakh stolen from a house in Navi Mumbai
48.article_body: Thieves broke into a house in Maharashtra's Navi Mumbai and stole cash and silver biscuits worth a total of ₹3.7 lakh, the police said. They broke into the house on May 4, when the complainant had gone out of town, police added. He returned on May 8 and immediately complained to the police about the robbery.

49.title: Travis Scott sued by woman for miscarriage due to Astroworld tragedy
49.article_body: Rapper Travis Scott has been sued by a woman who claims she suffered miscarriage after being "trampled and crushed" at the Astroworld concert. According to Entertainment Tonight, Shanazia Williamson stated she suffered "horrific injuries" at the 2021 music festival in Houston. Notably, ten people died and hundreds were injured following a stampede during Scott's performance at the concert.

50.title: TN SC/ST commission seeks response over ban on beef, pork at biryani fest
50.article_body: The Tamil Nadu State Commission for the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes has sought an explanation from the District Collector Tirupathur over the ban on beef and pork from the Ambur Biryani festival. The commission had called the move in the food festival, which was organised by the district administration, discriminatory against the SC, ST and the Muslim community.

51.title: TikTok sued by family of 10-yr-old US girl who died in viral challenge
51.article_body: The family of a 10-year-old US girl who choked herself to death allegedly while participating in TikTok's viral 'blackout challenge', has sued the platform. Nylah Anderson was found unconscious in her bedroom in December 2021. She spent five days in an ICU before succumbing to her injuries. Her family alleges TikTok's algorithm pushed the dare in front of her.

52.title: Want to see more acceptance for women behind camera: Lara Dutta
52.article_body: Lara Dutta said the industry has become accustomed to seeing women taking up more challenging roles behind the camera. "I want to see more acceptance [of that]," she said while taking examples of Alia, Deepika and Kangana who have their own production houses. "I want to see more women succeed within...business...because that's when you'll...see change in content," the actress added.

53.title: Can't pick Hardik in T20 WC squad for bowling 140 kmph in 2 games: Parthiv
53.article_body: Discussing all-rounder Hardik Pandya's potential selection in India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India player Parthiv Patel said, "You can't pick a player for bowling at 140 kmph in two matches." "You need to a pick a fully fit player...If he gets injured then what happens? It will be India's loss," added Parthiv.

54.title: Finland sees no direct military threats from Russia: Envoy
54.article_body: Finnish Ambassador to NATO Klaus Korhonen said there are no "direct military threats against Finland" by Russia at present. However, Finland expects potential "cyber harassment" and "disinformation campaigns" by Russia, he added. The comments come after Russia on Thursday warned Finland against joining NATO and threatened it with "retaliatory steps, both of a military-technical and other nature".

55.title: 19-year-old Tilak records most runs by a teenager in an IPL season, breaks Pant's record
55.article_body: MI's 19-year-old batting all-rounder Tilak Varma has set the record for scoring the most runs by a teenager in an IPL season. With his knock of 34*(32) against CSK, Tilak took his tally of runs in IPL 2022 to 368. The previous record was held by Rishabh Pant, who scored 366 runs in IPL 2017 as a 19-year-old for DC.

56.title: Govt issues norms after cutting precaution dose gap to 3 months for overseas travel
56.article_body: Those travelling overseas can now take the precaution COVID-19 vaccine dose three months (instead of the current nine months) after second dose, the government has said while releasing guidelines. Those travelling abroad for education, jobs, sports events or business etc can avail the facility. They aren't required to upload visas or travel documents on the CoWIN portal for the same.

57.title: NIA charges BSF officer, 10 others over arms supply to terrorists
57.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has filed a chargesheet against 11 accused, including a BSF officer, in connection with a case of pilferage of arms and ammunition and supplying weapons to a terrorist organisation in Jharkhand. The weapons were allegedly supplied by the accused persons to armed cadres of CPI (Maoist) and terrorist gang of Aman Sahu.

58.title: Parents who confined son with 22 dogs in Pune held, later get bail
58.article_body: The parents of an 11-year-old boy who allegedly confined their son at an apartment in Pune with 22 stray dogs were arrested on Thursday and later released on bail, police said. The couple was granted bail based on Code of Criminal Procedure, police added. "Medical test of the boy was done and he is doing well," a police sub-inspector said.

59.title: Video shows son of Tripura Dy CM misbehaving with MPs in Agartala hotel
59.article_body: A video showing Prateek Dev Varma, the son of Tripura Deputy Chief Minister Jishnu Dev Varma, allegedly misbehaving with a team of parliamentary members, who visited the state, has surfaced on social media. The incident took place at Polo Towers hotel in Agartala on Wednesday. Also, when the hotel officials tried to intervene, reportedly inebriated Prateek shouted invectives at them.

60.title: Tesla puts on hold plans to sell electric cars in India over import duties: Report
60.article_body: Tesla has reportedly put on hold plans to sell electric cars in India after the company failed to secure lower import taxes. Billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla has abandoned a search for showroom space in the country and reassigned some of its domestic team, Reuters reported citing sources. In 2021, Musk had said that India has the world's highest import duties.

61.title: Felt like a newcomer on set: Sharmila on returning to films after 12 yrs
61.article_body: Veteran actress Sharmila Tagore, who's set to make an acting comeback after a gap of 12 years with the film 'Gulmohar', has said she felt like a newcomer on set. "It was fun to work on a film with no pressure at all...It was liberating, more like a wonderful holiday," she added. 'Gulmohar' also stars Manoj Bajpayee and Suraj Sharma.

62.title: UAE President Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan passes away aged 73
62.article_body: United Arab Emirates' President Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan has passed away at the age of 73, state news agency WAM reported. Born in 1948, Sheikh Khalifa was the second President of UAE and 16th ruler of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi. He is expected to be succeeded by his half-brother Crown Prince Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan.

63.title: Kerala football team to get cash reward of ₹1.14 crore from state govt
63.article_body: Kerala government has announced a cash reward of ₹1.14 crore for the state's football team for winning this year's Santosh Trophy. The decision was taken in a cabinet meeting chaired by CM Pinarayi Vijayan. Notably, ₹5 lakh each will be given to 20 players and the head coach while the rest of the support staff will get ₹3 lakh each.

64.title: Gold worth ₹8.38 crore found hidden in vehicles in Assam, Nagaland
64.article_body: Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has said that it intercepted two oil tankers and a truck and seized smuggled gold worth ₹8.38 crore from separate points on the National Highway between Assam's Guwahati and Nagaland's Dimapur on Thursday. The gold, smuggled through Indo-Myanmar border, had been concealed in different parts of the vehicles. Five people were arrested in the matter.

65.title: Rubina Dilaik charging ₹10-15 lakh per week for Rohit's 'Khatron...': Reports
65.article_body: Bigg Boss 14 winner and actress Rubina Dilaik is reportedly charging between ₹10 to 15 lakh per week for 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12', hosted by Rohit Shetty. According to reports, 'Lock Upp' winner and stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui is charging between ₹3.5 to 4 lakh per week for the stunt-based reality show. Rubina will be the highest-paid contestant, reports stated.

66.title: Heavy traffic on Mumbai-Pune Expressway as truck, trailer collide
66.article_body: Commuters experienced a heavy traffic jam on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway on Friday morning after an accident occurred on the way to Mumbai, according to reports. The accident reportedly took place after a truck and a trailer collided with each other. Following this, a long queue of vehicles stretched for nearly one and a half to two kilometres, the reports added.

67.title: I don't think hybrid work method will work: Airbnb CEO Chesky
67.article_body: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky said that he didn’t believe that the hybrid method, wherein employees come to office two to three days per week, will work. He added that this eventually would lead people coming to office on a different day of the week. Chesky said a better version would be assuming that people will be wherever they work best.

68.title: 21-year-old model-actress Sahana found dead on her birthday in Kerala
68.article_body: A model and actress, Sahana, was found dead on her 21st birthday in Kerala's Kozhikode, with police taking her husband Sajjad into custody after her family alleged that she was murdered. "She used to cry all the time saying they (husband and his family) were torturing her," Sahana's parents said. Sajjad told police he found her dead in bathroom.

69.title: Ex-eBay exec charged with harassing US couple pleads guilty
69.article_body: Former director of global resiliency at eBay, David Harville, has pleaded guilty in the US to five conspiracy and stalking counts, becoming the last of seven ex-workers admitting to harassing a US couple who spoke against eBay. The seven people participated in a campaign against the couple that involved sending them disturbing home deliveries like cockroaches and a funeral wreath.

70.title: 70 kgs of lemons worth over ₹60,000 stolen from market in Ghaziabad
70.article_body: Some unidentified persons allegedly stole more than 70 kilograms of lemons, worth ₹60,000-70,000, from a vegetable market in Ghaziabad district on Wednesday night. According to the police, the thieves arrived on a motorcycle and a mini-truck, loaded 12 sacks of lemons onto the mini-truck and escaped within a few minutes. Police have registered a case and launched an investigation.

71.title: Gurmeet Ram Rahim gets bail in 2 cases linked to sacrilege incident in Punjab
71.article_body: Dera Sacha Sauda head Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh was on Friday granted bail by the Faridkot court in two cases of sacrilege. Singh has now got bail in all three cases linked to the 2015 sacrilege incident that took place in Bargari in Punjab. He is currently serving sentence in rape and murder cases in a jail in Rohtak, Haryana.

72.title: BJP brutalising minorities, glorifying Gandhiji's killers: Sonia at Cong's 'Chintan Shivir'
72.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi, while speaking at Chintan Shivir in Udaipur, said the BJP government was "brutalising minorities and glorifying Mahatma Gandhi's killers". "It has become...clear what PM [Narendra] Modi and his colleagues really meant by their slogan 'maximum governance, minimum government'," she added. "It means keeping the country in a permanent state of polarisation," Gandhi said.

73.title: MP govt delays police physical test due to heat as 2 aspirants die
73.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government has decided to postpone the physical fitness test for the police recruitment exam till June 2 due to "scorching" heat, the state Home Minister Narottam Mishra announced on Thursday. This comes after two police aspirants died during the physical tests. Both the deceased candidates had reportedly collapsed after the 800-metre race.

74.title: EU to provide new $520 million military aid to Ukraine
74.article_body: EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell said European Union would provide a further €500 million ($520 million) worth of military support to Ukraine. The latest aid package would increase the EU's funds for Ukraine's military support to a total of €2 billion, he added. Borrell also said the bloc would soon reach an agreement on an embargo on Russian oil.

75.title: I couldn't take my eyes off her: Pratik Gandhi on working with Tanuja
75.article_body: Pratik Gandhi, speaking about working with Tanuja in 'Modern Love: Mumbai', said, "She's what charisma is described as." Recalling an incident from the shoot, Pratik said, "We'd to go up almost four flights of stairs. Building was without...lift...I thought she must have gotten tired but as...camera started rolling, her energy level was on...different high. I...couldn't take my eyes off her."

76.title: Have realised my strengths, working on them in training: MI's Sams
76.article_body: MI all-rounder Daniel Sams, who posted 3/16 against CSK in IPL 2022, said after MI lost the first few games he realised that he was focussing on the batter too much and not on his strengths. "That was something to work on at training," he added. Sams was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in MI's five wicket win over CSK.

77.title: Jailed Maha minister Nawab Malik allowed private hospital treatment
77.article_body: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik, who is jailed in a money laundering case, was allowed by a special court in Mumbai to get treatment at a private hospital. Malik's lawyer had earlier told the court that he was undergoing treatment at state-run JJ Hospital in a serious condition. Malik had last month applied for bail on medical grounds for six weeks.

78.title: CSK's management not serious; if Dhoni leaves, they'll have nothing: Akhtar
78.article_body: Talking about CSK, former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said, "CSK's management didn't look serious about IPL 2022. If MS Dhoni leaves they are left with nothing." "One really cannot predict what Dhoni can do," added Akhtar. "Only CSK can explain why they suddenly gave Ravindra Jadeja the captaincy. They need to come next season with a clear mind," stated Akhtar.

79.title: Forest Department stops development work at Pune's Taljai hill
79.article_body: The Forest Department has decided to stop developmental works being undertaken at Pune's Taljai hill, according to an official statement. Notably, the move comes after residents of Sahakar Nagar met with officials and demanded the developmental work to be stopped. The department said that it would undertake tree plantation drive at the hill during the rainy season.

80.title: 50-yr-old man rapes 2 daughters aged 18 & 24 in Ludhiana; arrested
80.article_body: A 50-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping his two daughters in Ludhiana. Their mother alleged she caught her husband raping their 24-year-old daughter a few months back. When she threatened him about lodging a complaint, he had promised he won't repeat it. Later, she found that the accused had also raped her 18-year-old daughter and filed a complaint.

81.title: Aggressive act: Australia says it tracked a Chinese spy ship
81.article_body: Australia's Defence Ministry on Friday said that a Chinese naval intelligence ship had been detected off the country's western coast. The ship was in "close proximity to military and intelligence installations", Australian Defence Minister Peter Dutton said, adding that "it's an act of aggression". The Chinese vessel was not in Australian territorial waters, Australian PM Scott Morrison said.

82.title: Yuvraj Singh trolls Suresh Raina for CSK getting all out for 97 against MI
82.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh trolled Suresh Raina after CSK got all out for 97 against MI in their IPL 2022 clash on Thursday. Yuvraj shared a video, wherein he can be seen asking Raina, "Your team has been bowled out for 97. What would you want to say?" Raina can then seemingly be heard saying, "I haven't watched the match."

83.title: Karan Kundrra registers for flat worth ₹20 crore in Bandra: Report
83.article_body: Television actor Karan Kundrra has registered for a sea-facing flat worth over ₹20 crore in a building in Mumbai's Bandra, Free Press Journal reported. As per the report, the actor's new home has its own private lift and a swimming pool. Earlier, an article showing pictures of his purported home had gone viral on social media.

84.title: Disappointing: Petitioners on Delhi HC's split verdict on marital rape
84.article_body: Women activists and petitioners have shown their disappointment after the Delhi High Court's two-judge bench gave a split verdict on the criminalisation of marital rape. "We are disappointed that...violence that the married women undergo was not taken into consideration by [HC]," All India Democratic Women's Association's member Mariam Dhawale said. "We shall...appeal to...higher court," she said.

85.title: 20 people park cars on Patna flyover to celebrate b'day; video shows bullets being fired
85.article_body: A group of more than 20 people had parked their cars on a flyover in Bihar's Patna for a birthday celebration recently, a video of which is widely being circulated online. A man could be seen firing bullets in the air in the video. Police said they've taken immediate action, adding, "Four youths, including 'birthday boy' Saurav Yadav, are arrested."

86.title: US theatre installs IR cameras to catch people filming nude scenes
86.article_body: US' Broadway theatre has installed infrared cameras pointed at the audience to see if anyone is trying to use a recording device during nude scenes. This comes after someone posted videos of actor Jesse Williams and co-star Michael Oberholtzer online that were taken during a nude scene from a play. The camera system will be monitored in real-time.

87.title: B'wood should soon be making films only for OTT: Ram Gopal Varma
87.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma on Friday took to Twitter to write, "The way South films seem to be going in theatres and North films don't...it looks like Bollywood should be soon making films only for OTT." He had earlier stated Yash-starrer 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' is like "a large dark cloud casting a doomsday shadow on all the other big films".

88.title: Protest erupts over Kashmiri Pandit's killing in J&K; police lathicharge, use tear gas
88.article_body: Massive protests by Kashmiri Pandits erupted in various parts of Jammu and Kashmir after the killing of Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat by terrorists in Budgam. Police resorted to lathicharge and fired tear gas shells at protesters, who were trying to move towards the Airport Road. The protesters demanded a government job for Bhat's wife and free education for his daughter.

89.title: Sohail Khan and Seema Khan file for divorce after 24 years of marriage: Report
89.article_body: Salman Khan's brother Sohail Khan and Seema Khan have filed for divorce after 24 years of marriage, said The Times of India while quoting a source. The two were spotted outside the family court in Mumbai leaving separately. They got married in 1998 and have two children. Sohail and Seema are yet to release an official statement about their divorce.

90.title: Kim lookalike crashes Australian PM's event & talks to reporters, video viral
90.article_body: A man impersonating North Korean leader Kim Jong un gatecrashed an election campaign event attended by Australian PM Scott Morrison on Friday. A video of the incident that went viral online, showed the Kim 'lookalike' talking to reporters gathered there. On being asked to leave, the impersonator said, "Excuse me, you don't tell the supreme leader what to do."

91.title: Aamir to make cameo in son Junaid's web series 'Pritam Pyare': Report
91.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan will reportedly make a cameo appearance in son Junaid Khan's debut web series 'Pritam Pyare'. According to reports, Aamir had joined Junaid and the team in Rajasthan's Bagar on May 1 where he shot for a song and some hospital scenes over the week. Notably, Junaid Khan will make his Bollywood debut with YRF's 'Maharaja'.

92.title: Twitter deal is temporarily on hold, tweets Elon Musk
92.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Friday tweeted that his $44 billion deal to take Twitter private is "temporarily on hold". The deal has been put on hold "pending details supporting calculation that spam/fake accounts do indeed represent less than 5% of users", Musk said. Shares of the micro-blogging site fell over 20% in pre-market trading after Musk's tweet.

93.title: English is a global language and helps break barriers: AR Rahman
93.article_body: AR Rahman, speaking at an event on Thursday, said that English is a global language and helps break barriers. Rahman had earlier shared a Goddess Tamil poster following Home Minister Amit Shah's call for replacing English with Hindi as India's official language. "The rest of the world is waiting for India in terms of music," Rahman said at the event.

94.title: Rajkummar, Bhumi-starrer 'Bheed' to release in theatres on November 18
94.article_body: Filmmaker Anubhav Sinha's upcoming film 'Bheed', starring Rajkummar Rao and Bhumi Pednekar, will be released in theatres on November 18 this year. 'Bheed' is a socio-political drama jointly produced by Anubhav Sinha and Bhushan Kumar. It was shot across Lucknow in November last year and will mark Bhumi and Rajkummar's latest collaboration post 'Badhaai Do'.

95.title: 100 meat shops sealed in north Delhi in 1 week under civic body's drive
95.article_body: Hundred meat shops in north Delhi have been sealed by North Delhi Municipal Corporation authorities within one week over violation of norms under an ongoing drive against illegal temporary structures. NDMC said it has removed around 70-80 temporary structures from areas under its jurisdiction. "Such raids would continue in coming days to curb the illegal sale of meat," it added.

96.title: Swiggy buys Dineout from Times Internet for reported $200 million
96.article_body: Swiggy on Friday announced it has entered into a definitive agreement with Times Internet to acquire dining out and restaurant tech platform Dineout for a reported $200 million. Following the acquisition, Dineout will continue to operate as an independent app and its founders will join Swiggy. Founded in 2012 by four school friends, Dineout was acquired by Times in 2014.

97.title: Biden makes $150 million commitment to ASEAN leaders
97.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Thursday made energy and security pledges worth $150 million to Southeast Asian leaders during a two-day summit in Washington. The US-ASEAN Special Summit, held for the first time in Washington, comes as the US seeks to strengthen ties with Southeast Asian countries as part of its Indo-Pacific strategy in response to China's expansion.

98.title: Suspicious object at Pune railway station turns out to be firecracker
98.article_body: Bomb detection squads rushed to the Pune railway station on Friday after a suspicious object was found at the premises. "[It is] just a firecracker. We got it checked thoroughly. Nothing to worry about," Pune railways' Senior Divisional Security Commissioner Uday Singh Pawar said. The railway station had been evacuated after the object was found.

99.title: Leaked data shows China has jailed over 10,000 Uyghurs in Xinjiang
99.article_body: More than 10,000 Uyghurs have been imprisoned in the Xinjiang region by China, as per leaked data. The leaked data contains details about each prisoner's name, birth date, ethnicity, ID number, charge, address, sentence length, and prison. China has been repeatedly criticised by the West over the detention camps in Xinjiang, which it calls "vocational training centres".

100.title: Felt sad I couldn't marry Shammi, Kapoor family was strict with bahus: Mumtaz
100.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz said that she loved Shammi Kapoor "tremendously", adding that she "felt sad" that she couldn't marry him. "I was...around 17. He was 18 years older than me. It was too early for me to get married," Mumtaz said, adding that she wanted to achieve something and "Kapoor family was strict about their bahus not working in films".

101.title: An actor is expected to look beautiful even in death: Mumtaz
101.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz has stated that an actor is expected to look beautiful even in death, adding, "Janaaza bhi beautiful lagna chahiye (Funeral should also look beautiful)!" The actress further said that when she was undergoing cancer treatment 20 years ago, a "bloated" picture of hers was clicked and people made remarks about it like, "Mumtaz is finished."

102.title: Pakistan's common man not our opponent: Sharad Pawar recalls his Pak visit
102.article_body: During an Eid-Milan event in Pune, NCP supremo Sharad Pawar recalled his visit to Pakistan's Karachi for a cricket match. "We had taken our cricket team to Karachi...When we went to pay the bill (in a restaurant) they refused and said that we were their guests," Pawar said. "The common man of Pakistan is not our opponent," he added.

103.title: This is sad: B'luru Archbishop on K'taka anti-conversion ordinance
103.article_body: Bengaluru Archbishop Peter Machado reacted to the Karnataka Cabinet approving the anti-conversion bill and using the ordinance route to give it effect, saying, "This is sad." He also appealed to the state Governor to not give his assent to it. This will affect the "harmonious relationship that we enjoy with members of all the communities" in the state, he added.

104.title: Apple pins letters outlining employee benefits at US stores: Report
104.article_body: Apple has started publishing laminated copies of a letter in its US stores' backrooms highlighting and praising its benefits amid a union push, Bloomberg reported citing the letter. The two-page note outlines benefits such as vacation time, a 401(k) plan, product discount programs and health insurance. Each letter has been signed by the local individual managers.

105.title: SUV rams into truck on Yamuna Expressway, 5 of a pilgrim group die
105.article_body: Five people, including four women, died and two others were injured after their SUV rammed into a truck on Yamuna Expressway. The people killed in the accident were part of a pilgrimage group comprising 50 people. They were returning from Mathura and heading towards Kedarnath. While the seven were travelling in a Mahindra Bolero, the others were in a bus.

106.title: Severe dust storm turns day into night in US, residents share before-after pics
106.article_body: Severe dust storms hit Upper Midwest in US on Thursday. The sky darkened as an immense wall of dust covered the area and resulted in low visibility, turning day into night, pictures of which surfaced online. The storm intensified into a 'derecho', which is a widespread, long-lived wind storm associated with a band of rapidly moving showers or thunderstorms.

107.title: WazirX, CoinDCX delist crypto token LUNA after it crashes nearly 100%
107.article_body: Indian crypto exchanges WazirX and CoinDCX are delisting crypto token LUNA after it crashed nearly 100% in the last 24 hours. LUNA crashed after its sister token, TerraUSD or 'UST', a stablecoin that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, lost its peg. CoinDCX said that it has also delisted UST from its app with immediate effect.

108.title: One of the toughest things: Pique on 'horrible' initiation at Man Utd
108.article_body: Sharing his experience at former club Manchester United, Barcelona defender Gerard Pique said, "I had to say who was the [team's] best and worst player. It was one of the toughest things. That was my initiation, that was horrible." "I don't remember what I said," added Pique. Pique termed Manchester United's former manager Sir Alex Ferguson as a "second dad".

109.title: Over 2,000 kg of adulterated paneer seized in Mumbai; 7 arrested
109.article_body: Mumbai Police's Economic Offences Wing has seized over 2,000 kilograms of adulterated paneer from Dairy Punjab in Chembur, a report said. During an investigation, it was revealed that the accused used unsweetened milk powder, light palm oil and chemicals to produce harmful and low-quality cheese, disguised as "malai paneer". Meanwhile, seven persons, including the dairy owner, have been arrested.

110.title: Manchester City unveil Aguero statue on 10th anniversary of '93:20' moment, share pics
110.article_body: Manchester City on Friday unveiled a permanent statue of Sergio Aguero at Etihad Stadium on the tenth anniversary of the iconic '93:20' moment and the club's first Premier League title. The large-scale statue was created by award-winning sculptor Andy Scott using thousands of welded pieces of galvanised steel. City had clinched the title after Aguero's 94th minute goal against QPR.

111.title: 15 including doctors, officials of Pune clinic booked for kidney transplant malpractice
111.article_body: Fifteen people, including senior management officials and doctors of Pune's Ruby Hall Clinic, have been booked in connection with alleged malpractices in a kidney transplant conducted in March. A woman was promised ₹15 lakh to pose as the wife of a man who needed a transplant. The clinic's Managing Trustee, who has also been booked, said they were being harassed.

112.title: Terrorists asked who Rahul was, then shot him: Family of Kashmiri Hindu killed in J&K
112.article_body: The family members of government employee Rahul Bhat, who was shot dead by terrorists in Jammu on Thursday, have demanded an inquiry into his death. "First, they (terrorists) asked who Rahul Bhat is and then they shot him," his father said. "There was a police station 100 feet away...They should check CCTV footage," Bhat's father said.

113.title: Former minister's car pushed into lake by protesting Sri Lankans; video surfaces
113.article_body: A video showing protestors pushing a car that allegedly belonged to a former minister into a lake in Sri Lanka amid political and economic crisis has surfaced online. Cars of several politicians were reportedly pushed into water. "No gas, no fuel and...essential medications, and people are suffering. People are living with one meal a day," a protestor said.

114.title: Johar gets so much hate for nepotism but he signed me when I was nobody: Kiara
114.article_body: Kiara Advani in a recent interview praised filmmaker Karan Johar for signing her when she was a "nobody" in the industry. "I know he gets so much hate for nepotism and all of that...but he took me when I was a nobody, and nobody told him to," she said. Kiara worked in Karan Johar's segment of 2018 anthology 'Lust Stories'.

115.title: 15-yr-old gang-raped in a car by 5 men in Ranchi, accused arrested
115.article_body: A 15-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped and gang-raped inside a car by five men in Ranchi, Jharkhand. The victim alleged that she was forced into the car which was later found by a police patrol team with her in it in the district's Daladali village, Superintendent of Police (Ranchi-Rural) Naushad Alam said. Notably, all five accused have been arrested.

116.title: 73 of India's 100 unicorns have at least 1 founder from IIT: Report
116.article_body: Data shared by analytics firm Tracxn Technologies showed that 73 of India’s 100 unicorns have at least one founder from IITs. Out of these, the founders belong to seven of the 23 IITs, with IIT Delhi in the lead. About 21 unicorns have at least one founder who is an IIT Delhi alumni, followed by IIT Bombay, with 16.

117.title: Gurugram resident booked for filing false robbery case
117.article_body: A Gurugram resident was booked by the police after the former filed a false robbery complaint. The accused, identified as Kamal Singh, had called the control room alleging that he had been robbed of ₹4 lakh at gunpoint at the city's Jharsa flyover. Notably, Singh was in debt and therefore, came up with this robbery story, police said.

118.title: Healer tortured, killed in Kerala for not revealing his piles medicine details
118.article_body: A 60-year-old Mysuru-based traditional healer, known for one-time treatment of piles, was held captive for more than a year, tortured and then murdered in Kerala after he allegedly refused to reveal the secret formula behind his medicine for piles treatment. A Malayali businessman, working in the Middle-east, and three of his accomplices were arrested by the police in the matter.

119.title: BJP leader dies by suicide at his residence in Bengaluru
119.article_body: A BJP leader from Bengaluru's Herohalli ward was found dead at his residence on Thursday. According to a primary investigation conducted by the police, the 46-year-old man had died by suicide and no foul play is suspected. The deceased's cousin claimed that he was distressed by his thyroid illness. The police were informed about the incident around 7.30 pm.

120.title: Delhi, Mumbai could be 5°C warmer in 2080-99 than 1995-2014: Report
120.article_body: The mean annual temperature of Delhi and Mumbai will be 5°C higher in between 2080-99 as compared to the 1995-2014 period if global CO2 emissions double by 2050, Greenpeace India reported. Delhi's annual maximum temperature will jump to 45.97°C in the 2080-99 period. Chennai's annual maximum temperature will increase from 35.13°C at present to 38.78°C in the 2080-99 period.

121.title: 'Take tough decisions,' Sanjay Raut slams Centre over Kashmiri Pandit's killing
121.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut has slammed the central government over the targeted killing of Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam. "If even after the abrogation of Article 370...Kashmiri Pandits are not returning and those living in Kashmir are not safe. You (Centre) have to take tough decisions to end...instability that is building in J&K," Raut said.

122.title: NIA arrests 2 from Mumbai for alleged links with Dawood's gang
122.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Thursday arrested two people, Arif Abubakar Shaikh (59) and Shabbir Abubakar Shaikh (51) in connection with a case against fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim and his aides. NIA said the accused were close to gangster Chhota Shakeel and involved in illegal activities of Dawood's D-gang. NIA questioned them for four days before making the arrest.

123.title: Don't need certificate of patriotism from Yogi, BJP: Owaisi
123.article_body: Reacting to UP government's new order of making national anthem mandatory in the state's madrassas, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that Yogi Adityanath and BJP looked at madrassas with suspicion. "We tell Yogi Adityanath and BJP that don't give us the certificate of patriotism," he added. There was no Sangh Parivar when country was fighting for freedom, Owaisi further said.

124.title: Emily Blunt to star in criminal conspiracy film 'Pain Hustlers'
124.article_body: Actress Emily Blunt will be playing the lead role in the criminal conspiracy film 'Pain Hustlers'. The film will be directed by David Yates who is known for directing four films in the 'Harry Potter' series and the first three films of the series 'Fantastic Beasts'. Written by Wells Tower, 'Pain Hustlers' will go on floors on August 22.

125.title: SoftBank to cut fundings by half this yr after $26 bn Vision Fund loss
125.article_body: SoftBank may cut its startup investments this fiscal year by half or even a quarter of what it did in 2021, CEO Masayoshi Son said on an earnings call. The move follows a record loss reported by SoftBank's Vision Fund that stood at $26 billion for FY22. The firm had posted a record quarterly profit a year ago.

126.title: Xiaomi India's director of offline sales resigns amid tax evasion probe
126.article_body: Xiaomi India's director of offline sales, Sunil Baby, has resigned. The company said he decided to move on for personal reasons. Notably, there has been a report of tax officials freezing deposits worth $478 million lying in local bank accounts of Xiaomi in February as part of a probe into alleged tax evasion.

127.title: Sanya Malhotra, Rajkummar's 'HIT-The First Case' to release on July 15
127.article_body: Actress Sanya Malhotra announced on Friday that her upcoming film 'HIT-The First Case' will release on July 15 this year. The actress also shared a picture on Instagram with co-star Rajkummar Rao and director Sailesh Kolanu while making the announcement. 'HIT-The First Case' is the Hindi remake of the Telugu mystery action thriller of the same name.

128.title: Kim Jong-un seen wearing mask for the 1st time as N Korea reports COVID outbreak
128.article_body: Kim Jong-un was seen wearing a facial mask for the first time as he held a meeting with officials to discuss the COVID-19 outbreak in North Korea. In the past, everyone but the leader wore a mask. North Korea announced its first COVID-19 outbreak more than two years into the pandemic on Thursday, with Kim ordering a strict national lockdown.

129.title: I hope Du Plessis has told Kohli 'Go back 10 years, forget what you've done': Vaughan
129.article_body: Referring to Virat Kohli's poor form in IPL 2022, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan urged Kohli to "show some youthfulness". Vaughan added, "I hope Faf du Plessis has spoken to him and told him 'Go back 10 years, when you didn't have this profile. You're not married and don't have a kid...Forget your age, forget what you have done'."

130.title: Brendon McCullum appointed England's Test team head coach
130.article_body: Ex-New Zealand captain Brendon McCullum has been appointed the head coach of England's Test team. "I strongly believe in my ability to help the team emerge as a stronger force once we've confronted them head-on," McCullum said. He added, "Ben Stokes is the perfect character to inspire change around him and I look forward to working closely with him."

131.title: Rare pic of Karan Johar in non-designer clothes: Farah shares throwback pic
131.article_body: Farah Khan took to Instagram to share an old picture featuring Farhan Akhtar, Sajid Khan, Karan Johar, Rani Mukerji and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan. "Housewarming 2001 at the first home I bought," she wrote. "Aishwarya had come straight from 'Devdas' shoot thus sindoor and rare pic of Karan Johar in non-designer clothes," Farah added with a 'winking face with tongue emoji'.

132.title: First Russian soldier to go on trial in Ukraine for war crimes
132.article_body: Ukraine has disclosed plans to hold the first war crimes trial over Russia's ongoing invasion. The trial will bring to stand a 21-year-old Russian soldier, Vadim Shishimarin, accused of firing an automatic rifle from a car, killing an unarmed 62-year-old civilian on February 28 to prevent him from reporting a group of soldiers, Ukraine's Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova's office said.

133.title: I'll be suspended for 6 months if I talk: Arteta on refereeing in Arsenal's loss
133.article_body: Talking about the refereeing in Arsenal's 0-3 loss against Tottenham Hotspur, Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta said, "If I say what I think I am suspended for six months...Ask the referee to come here and explain his decisions." "Such a beautiful game was destroyed," added Arteta. "I am allowed to give my interpretation...but I do not like to lie," stated Arteta.

134.title: BJP-ruled MCDs plan to demolish 63 lakh houses: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia
134.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Friday claimed that BJP-ruled Municipal Corporations of Delhi (MCDs) plan to demolish 63 lakh houses using bulldozers in an anti-encroachment drive. He alleged that this will leave almost 70% of Delhi's population homeless. He also wrote a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah over the matter and urged him to stop the demolition.

135.title: Musk liking Dogecoin causes people to have meltdowns: Co-creator
135.article_body: Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus took to Twitter to say, "I...enjoy that Elon Musk liking Dogecoin causes people to have pointless meltdowns because he isn't talking about their arbitrary crypto of choice, cloaked by frail moral superiority." Markus' tweet followed Musk's reply to another tweet by him. "It [Dogecoin] has potential as a currency," Musk had said.

136.title: AAP alleges elderly man asked to leave Haryana minister's grievance meet
136.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has alleged that an elderly man was asked to leave a public grievances redressal meeting chaired by BJP minister Om Prakash Yadav in Haryana's Rewari. "When an elder raised the issue of his land...the...minister and...policemen misbehaved with the old man and threw him out," AAP tweeted while sharing a video of the alleged incident.

137.title: Westerners think we've maharajas and snake charmers only: Priyanka's mom
137.article_body: Priyanka Chopra's mother Madhu spoke about why her daughter keeps the Indian culture alive in her US home and said, "She wants to educate them that you've...misinformation about India." She added Westerners think "we've maharajas...and snake charmers only". "We've best education, IT & medical technology...Our rituals...have so much good behind them. She...tries to keep it up there," said Madhu.

138.title: I imitated Britney Spears, my mother was so 'shocked': Novak Djokovic
138.article_body: Discussing his previous imitation experiences, world number one Novak Djokovic said, "When [I was] at the Players Show in Monte Carlo, I imitated [singer] Britney Spears. I had denim shorts and a wig, my mother was so shocked." "After that I had to stop for a while," added Djokovic. "Maybe I [will] go back to doing imitations," stated Djokovic.

139.title: India will be free of those who talk of Congress-free country: Gehlot
139.article_body: Congress leader and Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that India will be free of those who talk of Congress-free country. Ahead of Congress' three-day Chintan Shivir, Gehlot said, "The country is passing through a critical period. Indira Gandhi, Rajiv Gandhi and Beant Singh were martyred. But today, the people in power ask what happened in the last 70 years."

140.title: Police forced me to leave Udaipur ahead of Cong's 'Chintan Shivir': BJP MP
140.article_body: Ahead of Congress' 'Chintan Shivir' in Udaipur, BJP MP Kirodi Lal Meena has alleged that he was forcefully shifted from Udaipur by the police. "SP came with a heavy police force and removed me without any reason (from Udaipur)...They just said that I am not allowed," Meena said. "This is a violation of my constitutional rights," he added.

141.title: Max temp likely to fall by 2-3 degrees in Delhi from Monday
141.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecasted that the maximum temperature of Delhi could fall by 2-3°C from Monday onwards. However, the heatwave-like conditions are expected to continue in the capital till Sunday, the IMD said. The maximum temperature is going to be around 44°C during this period. Notably, the Air Quality Index will remain in the 'moderate' category.

142.title: Police officer martyred in terrorist attack at his house in J&K
142.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir police on Friday said that Constable Reyaz Ahmad Thoker was martyred after terrorists fired at him at his residence in Pulwama. Thoker succumbed to his injuries at a hospital, police added. This is the second shooting incident in the Union Territory in the last 24 hours. Earlier, a Kashmiri Pandit was shot dead by terrorists in Budgam.

143.title: Don't know his diagnosis, he has had fever for last 2 weeks: Shane Watson on Prithvi Shaw
143.article_body: Delhi Capitals assistant coach Shane Watson has hinted that Prithvi Shaw could also miss his team's remaining IPL 2022 matches. "It's not looking great. I don't know his diagnosis exactly but he's had...fever for the last two weeks," he said. Recently, Shaw had shared a picture of himself from a hospital bed. DC will next face PBKS on Monday.

144.title: NASA releases night-time image showing 'heat islands' in & near Delhi
144.article_body: NASA has released a night-time image taken on May 5 by its Ecosystem Spaceborne Thermal Radiometer Experiment on Space Station instrument, showing "heat islands" in and near Delhi. Night-time temperatures in Delhi and several smaller villages were peaking at about 39°C, while the rural fields nearby had cooled to around 15°C. The image covers about 12,350 square kilometres.

145.title: Near consensus on one family, one ticket proposal: Congress ahead of 'Chintan Shivir'
145.article_body: Ahead of Congress' 'Chintan Shivir', AICC general secretary Ajay Maken said, "On the one family, one ticket proposal there is near consensus." "No person should be in a post for more than five years and there should be a cooling off period for three years," Maken added. "A wing will be set up for assessing leaders' performance," he further said.

146.title: It was a big mistake by MS Dhoni to step down as CSK captain: Kaif
146.article_body: Ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said MS Dhoni's decision to step down as CSK captain ahead of IPL 2022 was a "big" mistake. "If Dhoni's in the playing XI, he should be captain. Ravindra Jadeja...[wasn't] ready for...captaincy," added Kaif. Jadeja handed back CSK captaincy to Dhoni after the team lost six of their first eight IPL 2022 matches under his leadership.

147.title: Imagine what PBKS players are feeling about constant changes: Ajay Jadeja
147.article_body: Former India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said it has become "very hard" to assess PBKS. "When we...are confused with the constant changes, imagine what the players might be feeling," added Ajay. "I never expected [PBKS coach] Anil Kumble to bench Shahrukh Khan for Rishi Dhawan," stated Ajay. "There is an inconsistency in the thought process...and that is being reflected," said Ajay.

148.title: Rachakonda Police arrests 2 men for cheating MBBS aspirant of ₹12 lakh
148.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested two men for allegedly cheating an MBBS aspirant of ₹12 lakh on the pretext of providing a seat in a medical institution. According to police, the accused contacted MBBS aspirants and offered seats in coveted medical colleges. They then induced such aspirants to pay a huge sum of money in exchange for the seat, police added.

149.title: Several parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts from May 13 to 15
149.article_body: Several areas of Bengaluru will face power outages from May 13 to May 15 as the Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) will carry out maintenance and repair works during this period. The maintenance work will be carried out between May 13 and May 15 as maximum offices remain closed on weekends which decreases the load on the grid.

150.title: Motorola announces edge 30 as the world’s thinnest 5G phone
150.article_body: Aiming to disrupt India's premium smartphone market, Motorola has announced the launch of edge 30 as the world's thinnest 5G phone with 6.79 mm thickness & 155 gm weight. The smartphone, starting at ₹25,999* offers flagship features like 144Hz 10-bit pOLED display & India's first Snapdragon 778G+. It goes on sale starting May 19 on Flipkart & Reliance Digital stores.

151.title: Will create chaos: Supreme Court as it refuses to postpone NEET PG 2022 exam
151.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday dismissed a plea that sought the postponement of NEET PG 2022 exam. The court observed that postponing the exam will create chaos and uncertainty, while impacting patient care and treatment. The apex court also said that it cannot cause hardships to thousands of students who have been preparing for the exams because of some others.

152.title: CSK captaincy took a heavy toll on Ravindra Jadeja: Lalchand Rajput
152.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Lalchand Rajput said CSK all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja could not perform well in IPL 2022 as captaincy took a "heavy toll" on him. "CSK will miss the services of Jadeja as he was an important player," added Rajput. Jadeja has been ruled out of IPL 2022, owing to a bruised rib during CSK's defeat against RCB on May 4.

153.title: BJP wants to create a different type of Taliban system in India: Shiv Sena
153.article_body: The Shiv Sena criticised BJP saying that the party wants to create a different type of Taliban system in this country. BJP is playing politics of bigotry which can disturb peace of the nation, Shiv Sena said in its mouthpiece 'Saamana'. The Sena further said that BJP's Hindutva is an experiment to take the country back a thousand years.

154.title: Want to thank PM Modi for economic assistance: Sri Lanka's new PM
154.article_body: Sri Lanka's new PM Ranil Wickremesinghe thanked PM Narendra Modi for providing economic assistance to the country and said he looks forward to closer ties with India. Wickremesinghe was sworn in as PM on Thursday to stabilise the country's debt-ridden economy and end the political turmoil. India has provided assistance of over $3.5 billion to Sri Lanka this year alone.

155.title: No harm in dreaming: Sehwag on PBKS' chances of reaching IPL 2022 playoffs
155.article_body: Discussing PBKS' chances of reaching the IPL 2022 playoffs, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said there is "no harm" in dreaming. "They will have to believe that they can win...and that is something I have not seen...so far," added Sehwag. Discussing PBKS' match against RCB, Sehwag stated, "It is crucial that PBKS win. However, they don't win important matches anyway."

156.title: Get highly qualified experts to build your investment portfolio: dezerv.
156.article_body: Wealth-tech firm dezerv. aims to save your time and strategically manage your hard-earned money. Its experts with 20+ years of experience do all the heavy-lifting of researching, optimizing, and rebalancing your personalised investment portfolio that they build for you, it stated. Focus your time on what you do best, and let the experts secure your future, says co-founder Sandeep Jethwani.

157.title: Las Vegas casino gives ₹3.86 lakh bonus to each of its 5,400 employees
157.article_body: A Las Vegas casino has announced a $5,000 (around ₹3.86 lakh) bonus for all its 5,400 employees. "It's you, every single day, that makes a difference....Whether you clean the rooms, cook the food, dealing cards, serving drinks, at the front desk." said Daniel Espino, Cosmopolitan chief people officer. The all-employee bonus will cost us more than $27 million, company said.

158.title: Houses develop cracks amid metro work in Kolkata; 82 evacuated
158.article_body: At least 82 people have been shifted to nearby hotels after several houses in the Bowbazar area in Kolkata developed cracks amid the ongoing underground metro construction work, according to police. Earlier in 2019, several buildings in the area collapsed during metro construction work. "We're examining whether it is safe to let these buildings stand," Kolkata Mayor Firhad Hakim said.

159.title: Rahul gets relief from HC in case for calling Amit Shah 'murder accused'
159.article_body: The Jharkhand High Court granted relief to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in 2019 case for allegedly using derogatory remarks against Amit Shah and calling him a "murder accused". The HC has ordered no coercive action against Rahul Gandhi in connection with the case. The court stayed proceedings of a lower court in the matter and issued a notice to petitioner.

160.title: Mumbai Police busts sex racket at Worli spa, 3 women rescued
160.article_body: Mumbai Police raided a spa for running a sex racket and rescued three women in Worli. The decoy customer was asked to pick one of the women and told to pay ₹1000 for massage and additional ₹2000 for the woman's service. One of the women told police that the owner and manager kept a huge chunk of money earned.

161.title: SSLC exam results to be declared on May 19: Karnataka Education Minister
161.article_body: The results of Karnataka SSLC board exams will be declared on May 19, state Primary and Secondary Education Minister BC Nagesh announced on Friday. The results will be available at sslc.karnataka.gov.in and karresults.nic.in. Notably, over 8 lakh students had registered for the SSLC exams that were held between March 28 and April 11.

162.title: Pat Cummins ruled out of remaining IPL 2022 matches
162.article_body: KKR pacer Pat Cummins has been ruled out of the remaining IPL 2022 matches due to a hip injury. Cummins will fly back to Sydney and complete his rehabilitation before Australia's tour of Sri Lanka. Cummins took seven wickets in five IPL 2022 matches. He also smashed the joint-fastest fifty in IPL off 14 deliveries against MI this season.

163.title: Bride and groom set themselves on fire during wedding exit stunt in US; video viral
163.article_body: A video showing a bride and groom setting themselves on fire as they exited their wedding reception this week in US has gone viral on social media. Professional stunt doubles Gabe Jessop and Ambyr Bambyr met each other while working on the sets of Hollywood films. "These are trained professionals, don't try this at home," a wedding organiser said.

164.title: Sanctions hurting West more than Russia: Putin
164.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said that Western countries were more hit by sanctions imposed on Russia over its military operation in Ukraine than Moscow. The sanctions are "driven by oversized political ambitions and Russophobia", he added. Putin claimed that Russia is coping with "external challenges" provoked by Western sanctions and the inflation in the country is slowing down.

165.title: SpaceX shows Starlink's availability globally, India marked 'coming soon'
165.article_body: Elon Musk-owned SpaceX updated Starlink's availability globally, saying, "Starlink is now available in 32 countries around the world." It also released a map showing nations where the service is on the waitlist and others where it's expected to come soon. India, along with its neighbours Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Nepal, Bangladesh and Bhutan, was marked under 'coming soon'.

166.title: Gold worth ₹29 lakh concealed with rhodium coating seized at Hyd airport
166.article_body: The Hyderabad Customs on Thursday detected and seized 551.21 grams of gold worth ₹29.15 lakh from a male passenger at the Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. The gold was concealed with rhodium coating and fitted to two ladies handbags placed in the check-in baggage, Customs officials said. The passenger had arrived from Kuwait, they added.

167.title: LIC sets IPO issue price at ₹949; listing likely on Tuesday: Report
167.article_body: LIC has set its IPO issue price at ₹949 a share, at the top of its indicated range of ₹902-949, as per a report. It is likely to be listed on stock exchanges on May 17. The country's largest-ever IPO opened on May 4 and was oversubscribed 2.95 times on its final day of bidding on May 9.

168.title: He was such an elegant man: Chris Pratt recalls working with Irrfan
168.article_body: Hollywood actor Chris Pratt in an interview opened up about working with Irrfan Khan in the 2015 film 'Jurassic World' and said, "He was...such an elegant man." "It's really a rare combination for there to be such strength in softness...And that's what I'd call elegant - he could do very little, and still, he'd be doing so much," Chris added.

169.title: Putin humiliating himself on the world stage: UK
169.article_body: International sanctions against Russia should only be lifted when all of its troops have left Ukraine, UK Foreign Secretary Liz Truss told a meeting of G7 foreign ministers in Germany. "[Russian President Vladimir] Putin is humiliating himself on the world stage. We must ensure he faces...defeat in Ukraine that denies him any benefit and ultimately constrains further aggression," she added.

170.title: Stones pelted by 200 people at wedding procession due to social boycott: Guj police
170.article_body: Two people were injured after 200 people allegedly stone pelted a Dalit groom's wedding procession taken out at a village in Gujarat's Patan on Thursday. The incident was due to a "social boycott", police said. The gram panchayat had decided seven to eight years ago that wedding processions won't be taken out as an "austerity measure", SP Vijay Patel said.

171.title: CM Mann condemns trend of gun culture, gangsterism in Punjabi songs
171.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday condemned the trend of gun culture and gangsterism in Punjabi songs. He urged singers to "desist from fanning violence, hatred and animosity in the society through their songs". He further said, "Initially, we request them not to prop up such trend, failing which the government would be forced to act sternly against them."

172.title: Tesla shares drop by 26% ever since Musk offered to buy Twitter
172.article_body: Shares of Tesla have slipped by 26% ever since its CEO and world’s richest person Elon Musk offered to takeover Twitter on April 14. The shares have plunged on the fears that Musk will get distracted with Twitter. Meanwhile, shares of Twitter slipped to $45.23 on Thursday, nearly 20% below Musk’s offer price of $54.20 per share.

173.title: Former Union minister Pandit Sukh Ram cremated with full state honours in Mandi
173.article_body: Former Union Telecommunication Minister Pandit Sukh Ram was cremated with full state honours at Hanumanghat in Mandi on Thursday. Thousands of his followers gathered to pay last tributes to the leader at Seri Manch, where his mortal remains were kept. His son MLA Anil Sharma, grandson Aayush Sharma with wife Arpita and brother-in-law Salman Khan among others, attended the funeral.

174.title: Russian logistics ship on fire in Black Sea after strike: Ukraine
174.article_body: A Russian logistics ship caught fire after being struck near Snake Island, a small but strategic outpost in the Black Sea, a Ukrainian official said. The vessel, Vsevolod Bobrov, was left "limping" back to Sevastopol port, Serhiy Bratchuk, spokesman for the Odesa Regional Military Administration, said. "Vsevolod Bobrov...is one of the newest in the Russian fleet," Serhiy added.

175.title: Most dumb thing: Musk on hydrogen as tool for energy storage
