175.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in an interview dismissed hydrogen's use for energy storage, saying it's "the most dumb thing I could possibly imagine for energy storage". "I really can't emphasise this enough...Hydrogen is a bad choice," he said. He argued that "gigantic tanks" would be needed for storing hydrogen in liquid form, and gaseous form would need "even bigger" ones.

176.title: 19-yr-old biker dies while trying to avoid collision with cyclist in Mumbai
176.article_body: A 19-year-old biker died while trying to avoid a collision with a cyclist, coming from the opposite end, on a bridge in Mumbai's Bhayandar area. The deceased, identified as Jebas Nadar, was heading towards Mira Road with his friend, Sunil Pariyar (19), who suffered minor injuries. Notably, an FIR has been lodged against Nadar on Pariyar's complaint, police said.

177.title: Umpire trolled for changing signal from wide to out within seconds after CSK's appeal
177.article_body: On-field umpire Chirra Ravikanthreddy has been trolled for changing his signal from wide to out within seconds after CSK appealed for a caught-behind against MI's Hrithik Shokeen. The decision was overturned by DRS. "Umpire has got no clue...Going by the vibe of the appeal," a user tweeted. "This is officially the worst piece of umpiring I have seen," wrote another.

178.title: 4 booked in Thane for forging land documents to get ₹47 lakh compensation
178.article_body: Thane police have booked four unidentified persons for allegedly forging land documents to receive a compensation of over ₹47 lakh from the government. The accused submitted fake documents in the name of deceased persons for compensation in return for land acquired for a dam in Ambernath. The incident came to light when the legal heirs approached irrigation department for compensation.

179.title: Spain planning 3-day menstrual leave per month for women with severe pain
179.article_body: Spain is planning to introduce medical leave for women who suffer from severe period pain, according to a draft bill. The bill says women could have three days of leave a month - extended to five in some circumstances. Politicians have said that the draft, leaked to Spanish media outlets, was still being worked on.

180.title: Million-dollar mansions destroyed by wildfire in US; pics surface
180.article_body: Hundreds of people have been forced to evacuate from their homes due to a wildfire in US' California that has destroyed million-dollar mansions. The fire in Orange County, that has torched 20 mansions so far, has grown to 199 acres since it began on Wednesday. Meanwhile, the largest wildfire in the US has burned 170 homes in New Mexico.

181.title: Apply for loudspeaker permit by May 25: Bengaluru Police
181.article_body: The Bengaluru City Police Commissioner Kamal Pant asked people and establishments who require licence to use loudspeakers to submit an application on any working day to the jurisdictional Assistant Commissioner of Police (ACPs) by May 25. The jurisdictional ACPs have been designated as the licensing authority and enforcement officer for the use of loudspeakers, as per the release.

182.title: ₹10 lakh extorted from ex-deputy mayor of Gurugram; 2 arrested
182.article_body: Two persons were arrested for allegedly extorting ₹10 lakh from the former senior deputy mayor of Gurugram and BJP leader, Yashpal Batra (39). The accused were allegedly involved in sending a "fake" summon notice from the ED and the CBI asking Batra to appear before them. Notably, Batra was threatened that his bank accounts would get freeze, police said.

183.title: Terrorism resurgent in Afghanistan, could become global threat again: UN
183.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said that terrorism is resurgent in Afghanistan and could become a global threat again. "Terrorism is not only an attack on innocent people. It represents an all-out assault on human rights," Guterres added. "Responses to terrorism must be anchored in the rule of law, human rights, and gender equality to ensure their effectiveness," he further said.

184.title: Lost Babri Masjid, don't want to lose another: Owaisi on Gyanvapi mosque case
184.article_body: Reacting to Varanasi court's order to complete videographic survey of Gyanvapi mosque premises by May 17, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that the order of court is a "blatant violation" of Places of Worship Act 1991 and violation of SC's judgement in Babri Masjid dispute. "I have lost one Babri Masjid and I don't want to lose another," he added.

185.title: I'm concerned about my family's safety: Gyanvapi mosque case judge
185.article_body: Civil Judge Ravi Kumar Diwakar, who ordered the continuation of the survey of Uttar Pradesh's Gyanvapi mosque, on Thursday said that an “atmosphere of fear was created by making this civil case into an extraordinary case”. "The fear is so much that my family is always concerned about my safety and I am concerned about their safety," he added.

186.title: I'll never say I'm alone in industry: Kangana as Salman shares Dhaakad trailer
186.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories to thank Salman Khan for sharing a trailer of her upcoming movie 'Dhaakad'. "Wishing team #Dhaakad the very best," Salman wrote while sharing the trailer on his social media handles. "Thank you my Dabangg hero, heart of gold. I'll never say again that I'm alone in this industry...thank you from...entire Dhaakad team," Kangana responded.

187.title: Meta, Twitter asked to store proof of potential Russian war crimes
187.article_body: Four Democratic lawmakers have asked the CEOs of YouTube, TikTok, Twitter and Meta to archive content that could be used as evidence of potential Russian war crimes in Ukraine. In their letter, the lawmakers said such content "could potentially be used as evidence as the US...and international human rights and accountability monitors investigate Russian...crimes...and other atrocities in Ukraine".

188.title: Asked bowlers to show a lot of character vs MI, forget about result: Dhoni
188.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni said he asked his bowlers to show a "lot" of character, put the opposition under pressure and forget about the result, while attempting to defend 97-run total in his team's loss against MI. "Irrespective of how the wicket is, anything below 130 is difficult to defend," added Dhoni. Dhoni stated CSK's batters should've applied themselves better.

189.title: It was tense when we lost wickets upfront: Rohit on MI's win vs CSK
189.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said that the atmosphere was tense when his team lost wickets upfront while chasing a 98-run target against CSK. "After losing...wickets...we were calm and got the job done," added Rohit. Talking about MI all-rounder Tilak Varma who scored 34*, Rohit stated, "He [will soon]...be an all-format player for India." MI defeated CSK by five wickets.

190.title: Employee fired by Twitter changes bio to 'unemployed'; thanks team members
190.article_body: The second top executive who was fired by Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, has changed his Twitter bio to ‘unemployed’. In a now deleted tweet, Bruce Falck, who oversaw revenue, had written, “I'll clarify that I too was fired by (Parag)." Falck later thanked his team in a tweet thread and said he can't wait to see their future work.

191.title: Robots may assemble UK's demonstrator solar power plant in space
191.article_body: The UK Space Energy Initiative has established a 12-year development plan that could lead to robots assembling a demonstrator solar power plant in orbit. This plant will beam gigawatts of power from space to Earth as early as 2035, the initiative's chairman said. The initiative was launched last year to explore options to develop a space-based solar plant.

192.title: Congress expels former Union Minister KV Thomas for 'anti-party' activities
192.article_body: Congress on Thursday expelled former Union Minister KV Thomas for alleged "anti-party" activities, said KPCC chief K Sudhakaran. The decision came hours after Thomas shared stage with CPI(M) leader and Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan in a bypoll meeting of the left party-led front. Thomas had said he would campaign for LDF candidate Jo Joseph in the upcoming Thrikkakara Assembly bypoll.

193.title: Pune businessman cheated of ₹12.5 lakh by online fraudster
193.article_body: A Pune-based businessman was allegedly duped of ₹12.5 lakh by an online fraudster after the latter made the victim download a 'remote desktop' software on the promise of generating huge profits. The FIR has been registered under IPC Sections 419, 420 and 34. Notably, the 58-year-old victim first came in contact with the fraudster in October 2021.

194.title: Home away from home: Katrina shares pic with Vicky from Priyanka's NY restaurant
194.article_body: Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal recently visited Priyanka Chopra's Indian restaurant Sona, located in New York, US. Taking to Instagram Stories, Katrina shared a picture from the restaurant, writing, "Home away from home...loved the vibe. Priyanka, as always everything you do is just amazing." Priyanka reacted to Katrina's post, writing, "Love you honey! So glad you guys could make it."

195.title: Is the generator only for stadium lights: Sehwag on DRS incident in CSK-MI match
195.article_body: Talking about CSK's Devon Conway not being able to use DRS against MI due to power cut, Virender Sehwag said, "Is the generator only for stadium lights and not for...broadcasters and their systems?"  He added, "If the match was happening...DRS should definitely have been used or DRS shouldn't have been used in...entire match because this was a disadvantage for CSK."

196.title: India reports 2,841 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 18,604
196.article_body: India has reported 2,841 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,827 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 18,604, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,190, according to the latest data.

197.title: 630-foot-deep giant sinkhole with forest at the bottom discovered in China
197.article_body: A 630-foot-deep giant sinkhole with a forest at the bottom has been discovered in China's Leye County, the Xinhua news agency reported. Zhang Yuanhai, senior engineer at the Institute of Karst Geology of China Geological Survey, said that there are three caves within the sinkhole. "This is cool news," said an official from US' National Cave and Karst Research Institute.

198.title: Europe should pay more: Trump criticises US' $40 bn aid bill for Ukraine
198.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has criticised President Joe Biden's request for an additional $40 billion in aid to war-hit Ukraine, which is currently making its way through Congress. "Why are we giving over $40 billion to Ukraine while Europe, by comparison, is giving very little, and they're greatly more impacted by a Russian invasion, obviously, than...US," Trump said.

199.title: Couple attempts suicide outside Mumbai's Mantralaya, detained by police
199.article_body: A couple from Maharashtra's Nanded attempted suicide by pouring kerosene on themselves outside Mumbai's Mantralaya building, an official said. Raju Hulgude, the man who attempted suicide with his wife, had allegedly not received payment from the public works department for road construction work carried out by him. The police arrested the couple and they are being counselled, the official said.

200.title: 18-yr-old suffers eye injury after stray cow attacks him in Vadodara
200.article_body: An 18-year-old youth suffered serious eye injuries after a stray cow's horn pierced into his eye while he was riding a two-wheeler in Vadodara on Wednesday. The cow suddenly jumped from the road divider and collided with Henil Patel on the road. Following this, his two-wheeler skidded, throwing him to the ground. Passersby rushed him to a nearby hospital.

201.title: Punjab man dies after taking drugs, friends dump his body in drain
201.article_body: The body of a 25-year-old missing man suspected to have died after drug consumption was recovered from a drain by Moga Police on Thursday. According to police, Amandeep Singh's three friends, who allegedly gave him drugs, panicked after he died. They stuffed his body in a gunny bag and threw it in a drain. He went missing on May 8.

202.title: Not planning company-wide layoffs: Twitter CEO to staff after 2 executives fired
202.article_body: After Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal fired two top executives and froze hiring ahead of Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s takeover, he shared a memo with this staff. He wrote that while no "company-wide layoffs" are planned, "leaders will continue making changes" to improve efficiencies as needed. He added, "It’s​​ critical to have the right leaders at the right time."

203.title: Crypto billionaire reveals 7.6% stake in trading app Robinhood
203.article_body: Cryptocurrency billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried has revealed a 7.6% stake in Robinhood Markets, filings revealed. Bankman-Fried has said he doesn't have any intention of taking control of Robinhood. However, the filing also said he may "from time to time engage in discussions" with management. Shares of Robinhood were up more than 27% in after-hours trading following the disclosure.

204.title: Joe Biden was elected as people wanted less drama: Elon Musk
204.article_body: World’s richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday tweeted that US President Joe Biden’s "mistake is that he thinks he was elected to transform the country, but actually everyone just wanted less drama." Earlier, Musk had also said that he would reverse Twitter’s ban on former US President Donald Trump and said that the ban was "morally wrong".

205.title: Bombay HC allows woman to terminate 28-week pregnancy
205.article_body: The Bombay High Court allowed a woman to terminate her pregnancy in the 28th week after her foetus was diagnosed with serious anomalies. There was risk of serious physical disabilities with very high morbidity and mortality, the doctors said. The Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act permits pregnancy termination until 20th week, beyond which permission has to be sought from HC.

206.title: US, UK agree to collaborate on commercial spaceflight missions
206.article_body: The British government has announced that the US and Britain have agreed to collaborate on future commercial spaceflight missions. It said the partnership will make spaceflight easier and cheaper. The two nations will collaborate on the licensing of commercial space launches and provide benefits including critical defence security and better weather forecasts.

207.title: Man, his parents & brother kill wife over dowry in Pune; booked
207.article_body: Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad Police have booked a man, his parents and his brother for the alleged murder of his wife over dowry. The woman's body, which the accused had purportedly dumped on the railway track near Kasarwadi railway station, was found in March. The case was filed under Sections 120 B (criminal conspiracy), 302 (murder) and 304 B (dowry death).

208.title: 3 severely injured as gas stove explodes at laundry shop in Thane
208.article_body: Three men of a family suffered serious injuries after a gas stove exploded at their laundry shop in Thane's Diva on Thursday. According to officials from Regional Disaster Management Cell, the mishap occurred around 2.40 pm when the three were having lunch. "Hiraman...suffered 55% burn injuries, Puran has 75% burn injuries and Ajay has 65% burn injuries," an official said.

209.title: 11 drown as Haitian migrant boat capsizes near Puerto Rico
209.article_body: At least 11 people have drowned and 31 others have been rescued after a boat carrying migrants from Haiti capsized near Puerto Rico, the US Coast Guard said on Thursday. It wasn't immediately clear how many people were aboard the vessel when it turned over, Coast Guard spokesman Ricardo Castrodad said, adding that a "mass rescue effort" was still underway.

210.title: Mysterious metal balls fall from space in Gujarat, pics surface
210.article_body: Mysterious metal balls fell from space at four different locations in Gujarat's Anand district. Residents reportedly rushed out of their homes fearing an earthquake after hearing a loud sound. As per police, the objects are believed to be fragments of a satellite. The metal balls have been sent to a forensic science laboratory, police added.

211.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as CSK get eliminated from playoffs race?
211.article_body: CSK have been eliminated from IPL 2022 playoffs race after losing to MI on Thursday. CSK are ninth on the points table with eight points from 12 matches, while MI are placed last with six points. LSG (16), RR (14), RCB (14), DC (12), SRH (10), KKR (10) and PBKS (10) are in contention for the remaining playoffs spots.

212.title: We are in close touch with India on standing up against Russian aggression: US
212.article_body: The US continues to be in close touch with India about its efforts to rally the world to stand up against Russian aggression, the White House said on Thursday. "That means implementing and abiding by sanctions that have been put in place," White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki told reporters at her daily news conference.

213.title: Pic of Rahul Dravid attending a book event in Bengaluru goes viral
213.article_body: A picture of India head coach Rahul Dravid attending a book event has gone viral on Twitter. A Twitter user, Kashy, narrated how Dravid walked in alone to the event and sat in last row before being asked by Gundappa Viswanath to sit in the first row. "Hats off to his simplicity," a user commented. "Dravid epitomises humility," wrote another.

214.title: 213 spun pole transformers put up to save public space in B'luru
214.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) has installed 213 of the 2,587 transformers with single spun poles to help save public space. "The idea is that the transformers...constructed on drains and footpaths over three-four poles will be replaced with the newly designed ones," an official said. According to BESCOM, it has carried out maintenance of 4,802 transformers till May 11.

215.title: Not how I imagined leaving Twitter: Executive who was sacked during paternity leave
215.article_body: The Twitter executive who led the company's consumer division and was fired by CEO Parag Agrawal, revealed that he is currently on his paternity leave. Kayvon Beykpour tweeted, "This isn't how and when I imagined leaving Twitter...this wasn't my decision. Parag asked me to leave after letting me know that he wants to take the team in a different direction."

216.title: 3,50,000 people treated for fever, 6 died: N Korea after COVID-19 outbreak
216.article_body: After acknowledging a COVID-19 outbreak, North Korea said that six people died and 3,50,000 have been treated for a fever that has spread "explosively" across the nation. It added that 18,000 people were newly found with fever symptoms on Thursday alone, and 1,87,800 people are being isolated. One of the six people who died was confirmed infected with Omicron variant.

217.title: Twitter fires 2 top executives, freezes hiring ahead of Musk's takeover
217.article_body: Twitter on Thursday confirmed it has fired two of its senior executives who oversaw consumer and revenue divisions and has paused hiring ahead of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's takeover of the company. CEO Parag Agrawal in a memo to his employees also said Twitter will review all existing job offers to determine whether any "should be pulled back".

218.title: Manipal University Jaipur offers UGC-entitled online degrees
218.article_body: NAAC A+ accredited Manipal University Jaipur offers UGC-entitled online degrees like MBA, MCA, B.Com, BBA, BCA, etc. It invites students to get a degree while working or pursuing other commitments and benefit from offerings like scholarships, a vast alumni network, free access to Coursera, and additional professional certification courses worth ₹50,000, encouraging them to book their seats soon.

219.title: 7 held over online investment fraud in MP, ₹50 lakh found in account
219.article_body: Police arrested seven persons for cheating people on the pretext of an online investment in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch and recovered two cheque books, 19 keypad mobile phones and nine android phones. The accused confessed that they randomly called people and asked them to invest in the share market, police said. Over ₹50 lakh was credited to their account, police added.

220.title: India in relatively stronger position than many nations: Finance Secy
220.article_body: India is economically in a relatively stronger position than many other countries, Finance Secretary TV Somanathan said. He stated that owing to the large domestic production of wheat, India has at least escaped the global foodgrain crisis amid Ukraine-Russia war. However, he added that India cannot be immune to geopolitical challenges as it's part of the global economy.

221.title: I never called Zeeshan Khan a terrorist on 'Lock Upp': Payal Rohatgi
221.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Payal Rohatgi has denied calling Zeeshan Khan a terrorist on the reality show. "Many statements, not just mine, were interpreted in different ways throughout the show. Zeeshan is a good boy and was a strong competition," she added. Earlier Zeeshan, after eviction, has said, "The halal meat topic went on to Payal calling me a terrorist."

222.title: BJP alleges forcible land acquisition by TMC in WB, holds protest
222.article_body: BJP leaders Sukanta Majumdar, Suvendu Adhikari along with other MLAs carried out a protest rally in West Bengal's Deocha Pachami, against the alleged "forcible land acquisition" by TMC for mining project. "There are small farmers and tribals who are the inhabitants of this place. We are by these poor people and won't allow eviction," State BJP President Sukanta Majumdar said.

223.title: Inflation impacted rich more than poor in FY22: Finance Ministry
223.article_body: Evidence on consumption patterns suggests that inflation in India has impacted the low-income strata lesser than the high-income groups, Finance Ministry wrote in its economic review report for April. It stated that in FY22, inflation for the bottom 20% of urban consumers fell to 5.7% from 6.8%. Meanwhile, inflation for the top 20% fell to 5.7% from 6.5%, it added.

224.title: CSK out of IPL 2022 playoffs race as MI record their 3rd win
224.article_body: Bottom-placed MI defeated ninth-placed CSK by five wickets to register their third victory in IPL 2022. With the defeat, CSK are now officially out of contention for a place in the playoffs. The match witnessed CSK getting dismissed for 97, their second-lowest total in IPL. MI pacer Daniel Sams took three wickets, while Tilak Varma top-scored for MI with 34*(32).

225.title: Depp's ex-girlfriend Ellen to testify as Amber's witness in trial: Report
225.article_body: Johnny Depp's ex-girlfriend Ellen Barkin will reportedly be testifying in Amber Heard's defence in the defamation trial against the actress. Ellen, who dated Depp in the late 1990s, reportedly testified at Depp's libel case in the UK that he threw a wine bottle in her direction during an argument. Depp denied her claims, saying she held a "grudge" against him.

226.title: We have devised strategy to beat BJP in BMC polls: Maha Congress
226.article_body: The Maharashtra Congress said that it has "devised a strategy" to defeat the rival BJP in the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections. "The BJP will not get more than 30 corporators in the BMC elections," Maharashtra Congress spokesperson Atul Londhe said.  When asked about an alliance with the Shiv Sena, Londhe said, "There is little chance of an alliance."

227.title: Man shot dead in Bihar for honking and asking for passage for car
227.article_body: A man was shot dead in Bihar's Aurangabad late on Wednesday night for honking while asking for a passage for his car, police said. The victim, Sanjit Kumar Singh, was returning from his brother-in-law's pre-wedding ceremony when he honked to ask the accused, Santosh Kumar Singh, to give way for his car. Santosh then shot Sanjit in his head.

228.title: Targeted killings continue in J&K: Ex-CM on Kashmiri Pandit's killing
228.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister and NC leader Omar Abdullah condemned the killing of Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam and said, "Targeted killings continue and a sense of fear grows unchecked." He also extended condolences to Bhat's family. Rahul Bhat was a government official, who was shot at by terrorists in his office.

229.title: Denmark to charge ex-defence minister for leaking state secrets
229.article_body: Denmark's public prosecutor is set to formally charge former Defence Minister Claus Hjort Frederiksen who has been accused of leaking state secrets, the country's justice ministry said. Frederiksen served as Denmark's defence minister from 2016 to 2019 and is currently under parliamentary immunity as he's a lawmaker. He could face up to 12 years in jail if convicted on charges.

230.title: Palestinian Prez blames Israel for the killing of Al Jazeera journalist
230.article_body:
Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas has said that Israeli authorities were "fully responsible" for the killing of Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh. He said that 
Palestinian National Authority "will go to the International Criminal Court to track down the criminals". The 51-year-old journalist was reportedly "shot in the face" while she was covering an Israeli military raid in West Bank.

231.title: 2 pilots dead after helicopter crashes at Raipur airport
231.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Thursday said that two pilots, Captain Panda and Captain Srivastava, died after a state helicopter crashed at an airport in Raipur. "May God give strength to his family members and peace to the departed soul in this time of grief," he added. The accident reportedly took place when they were trying to land the helicopter.

232.title: Over 6 million people have fled Ukraine since Russian invasion: UN
232.article_body: At least six million have fled Ukraine since Russia began its military offensive there, a UN refugee agency confirmed on Thursday. Most refugees have crossed over to the European Union through border points in Poland, Slovakia and Hungary among other countries. Over eight million people have been internally displaced in Ukraine, according to International Organization for Migration (IOM) report.

233.title: Kolkata Traffic Police mandated to carry firearms on night duty
233.article_body: The Kolkata Police Headquarters issued a notification directing traffic police personnel to mandatorily carry firearms on night duty. "Firearms and ammunition must be collected from the local police station before joining night duty. When the duty is over, firearms have to be deposited there," it stated. Traffic policemen face several issues during naka checking when unarmed, police said.

234.title: Dacoity attempt foiled in Maharashtra's Thane; 4 arrested
234.article_body:
Officials said that police foiled a dacoity attempt and arrested four persons in Maharashtra's Thane.
They said that they arrested the accused near a liquor bar and recovered three country-made revolvers, eight bullets and a motorcycle from them. Interrogation revealed that the accused were planning to rob farmhouses in Thane city and Karjat, they added.

235.title: Not attempting to be Tiger: Arjun on his physical transformation
235.article_body: Arjun Kapoor, talking about his 15-month physical transformation, said he's not Tiger Shroff and isn't attempting to be like him. "I want to be the best version of Arjun that has been loved by audiences," he added. Arjun said his body has changed since his Bollywood debut which is why it took him 15 months to get in shape.

236.title: Bollywood definitely can't afford Mahesh Babu, he is correct: Kangana
236.article_body: Reacting to Telugu actor Mahesh Babu's 'Bollywood can't afford me' remark, actress Kangana Ranaut has said, "He is absolutely correct." Kangana added she knows that Mahesh gets many offers from various filmmakers. "His generation of actors has made the Telugu film industry the number one film industry in India. So, Bollywood definitely cannot afford him," she concluded.

237.title: Tesla to face its 1st jury trial in US over fatal Model S crash
237.article_body: Tesla is set to face its first jury trial over a car crash after a US court rejected its request to dismiss a case without trial. In 2018, 18-year-old Barrett Riley, who was driving a Tesla Model S, died after his car engulfed into flames after hitting a wall at 116 miles/hour. The lawsuit alleges the car's battery was defective.

238.title: Katrina not pregnant, reports of her pregnancy untrue: Actress' team
238.article_body: The respective representatives of actors Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif have denied the reports that claimed that the actress is two months pregnant. Katrina's team categorically denied the rumours of the actress' pregnancy, adding that they are untrue. Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif tied the knot on December 9, 2021, at The Six Senses Fort Barwara in Rajasthan.

239.title: Yamuna level low, water supply likely to be hit in Delhi on Friday
239.article_body: Water supply is likely to be affected in parts of Delhi on May 13 on account of the water level depleting in the Yamuna river, according to the Delhi Jal Board. The water supply is likely to be hit in parts of Kamla Nagar, Model Town, Civil Lines, Karol Bagh, Greater Kailash, Moolchand, Burari, Tughlakabad, Kalkaji, Jahangirpuri and more.

240.title: Delhi AAP MLA Amanatullah arrested for protesting against anti-encroachment drive
240.article_body: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan was arrested by Delhi Police on Thursday after he took part in a protest against South Delhi Municipal Corporation's anti-encroachment drive at Madanpur Khadar. He was detained by the police in the morning. Police had said that protesters pelted stones at security personnel, leaving a few injured.

241.title: We have to take 'retaliatory steps' if Finland joins NATO: Russia
241.article_body: Russia on Thursday warned Finland against joining NATO and threatened it with "retaliatory steps, both of a military-technical and other nature". Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said Finland's move to join NATO was "definitely" a threat to Russia, adding, "NATO expansion doesn't make our continent more...secure." This comes after Finland said the country should apply to join NATO "without delay".

242.title: Pics show crowd as Rahul takes train to Udaipur; coolie gives him flowers
242.article_body: Congress has shared pictures showing crowded platform as Rahul Gandhi boarded train to Rajasthan's Udaipur to take part in the three-day Chintan Shivir. A video has also been shared, which showed the leader meeting a delegation of the coolie association, with one of them handing flowers. Congress earlier said the party will introspect its strengths and weaknesses during 'Chintan Shivir'.

243.title: Delhi logs 1,032 COVID-19 cases in last 24 hrs, active cases at 4,928
243.article_body: Delhi on Thursday recorded 1,032 fresh COVID-19 cases and zero deaths, while the active cases in the city stand at 4,928, according to data shared by the state health department. The national capital's overall covid tally has increased to 18,98,173 while the death count stood at 26,184. Delhi reported 970 fresh COVID-19 cases and one death on Wednesday.

244.title: PM's wrong economic policies led to current financial crisis: Pawar
244.article_body: NCP leader Sharad Pawar on Thursday said it was PM Narendra Modi's "wrong economic policies that led to the current financial crisis". "Decisions such as demonetisation made without people’s participation are mainly responsible for it," he added. However, he said there was no fear of India facing a similar situation to that of Sri Lanka.

245.title: Will fulfil challenge of uplifting Sri Lanka's economy: PM Wickremesinghe
245.article_body: Newly-appointed Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Thursday that he's taken up the challenge of uplifting the country's economy amid ongoing crisis and will ensure that he fulfils it. He added that anti-government protesters "should stay" and engage with the administration. Wickremesinghe's appointment came days after ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa resigned amid clashes that claimed eight lives.

246.title: Israel approves construction of over 4,000 homes in West Bank: Report
246.article_body: Israel on Thursday approved the construction of 4,427 new homes in its settlements on the West Bank, a watchdog group said. The move comes days after Israel's Interior Minister Ayelet Shaked announced the plan to build these houses. "Israel's program of expanding settlements deeply damages the prospect for a two-state solution [with Palestine]," the US State Department said.

247.title: Punjab teachers fight over free lunch after meeting CM, video surfaces
247.article_body: A video has surfaced showing school teachers in Punjab pushing each other to get a plate of free lunch after a meeting with CM Bhagwant Mann. He had called the meeting with school teachers and principals to discuss reforms in education. The government had arranged lunch for the teachers at the venue.

248.title: Will never have guts to have baby out of wedlock: Masaba Gupta
248.article_body: Masaba Gupta said despite being a modern woman she'll never have the "guts" to have a baby out of wedlock. "I don't want to take that extra pressure and put a child in that space," she stated. Masaba, who is the daughter of Neena Gupta and Viv Richards, added, "I've been tagged too modern for being born out of wedlock."

249.title: Chennai Super Kings record their second-lowest total in IPL
249.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) on Thursday were dismissed for 97 runs in 16 overs against Mumbai Indians (MI). It is their second-lowest total in IPL. This is the second time in IPL that CSK were bowled out for less than 100 runs. CSK's lowest IPL total had come on May 5, 2013, when they were dismissed for 79 against MI.

250.title: 'Very big opposition leader told me becoming PM twice is enough,' reveals PM Modi
250.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday revealed that a "very big" opposition leader met him one day and said that becoming Prime Minister of the country twice was enough. "He doesn't know that Modi is made of a different mettle...That's why I don't believe in taking it easy...My dream is saturation, 100% coverage of the welfare schemes," PM Modi said.

251.title: Those behind Kashmiri Pandit's killing won't go unpunished: J&K Lt Guv
251.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Thursday condemned the killing of a Kashmiri Pandit after he was shot dead by militants in the valley. "I strongly condemn the barbaric killing of Rahul Bhat by terrorists at Budgam. Those behind this despicable terror attack will not go unpunished," he said. The government stands with the bereaved family, he added.

252.title: Which states/UTs have the highest percentage of wealthy households in India?
252.article_body: In the recently released data of the National Family Health Survey 5 (NFHS) report, Chandigarh (79%) is stated to have the largest number of wealthy households in India based on the percentage distribution of its residents. This is followed by Delhi (68%) and Punjab (61%). Haryana, Puducherry and Kerala have over 40% of their population in the highest wealth quintile.

253.title: There will never be a 'Congress-mukt' India: Rajasthan CM Gehlot
253.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday said there will never be "a Congress-mukt Bharat" and that those wishing so will themselves be decimated. People look at Congress as the main opposition and through the Chintan Shivir, a new message will be sent across the country, Gehlot further said. India has been run on the principles of Congress, he added.

254.title: Pic of Shah Rukh Khan, Rajkumar Hirani from 'Dunki' sets goes viral
254.article_body: A picture of actor Shah Rukh Khan and filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani from the sets of 'Dunki' has gone viral on social media. In the picture, Shah Rukh can be seen wearing a grey t-shirt and dark jeans, along with sunglasses. Commenting on the pic, a Twitter user wrote, "He's looking so fresh, same as 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' Shahrukh."

255.title: West's arms supplies to Ukraine may trigger conflict with NATO: Russia
255.article_body: The Deputy Secretary of Russia's Security Council, Dmitry Medvedev, on Thursday warned that the increasing military support given to Ukraine by the West may trigger a conflict between Russia and the NATO military alliance. He said, "Such a conflict always has the risk of turning into a full-fledged nuclear war." "This will be a disastrous scenario for everyone," he added.

256.title: Ashni Biyani resigns as Future Consumer MD due to 'personal constraints'
256.article_body: Ashni Biyani, daughter of Future Group CEO Kishore Biyani, has resigned as the MD of Future Consumer Limited citing "personal constraints and challenges", the company said in a stock exchange filing on Thursday. "She has also ceased to be a 'key managerial personnel' of the company," the company further said. She will continue to serve as Future Consumer's Non-Executive Director.

257.title: WHO must be reformed & strengthened: PM Modi at Global COVID Summit
257.article_body: While speaking at the second US-hosted virtual global summit on COVID-19, PM Narendra Modi said the World Health Organization (WHO) must be reformed and strengthened to build a more resilient health security architecture. "India is ready to play a key role in this effort," he added. PM Modi said India adopted a people-centric strategy against the pandemic.

258.title: We use traditional medicines in India to boost immunity: PM at COVID summit
258.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking at second US-hosted global virtual summit on COVID-19 said, "In India, we extensively use our traditional medicines to supplement our fight against COVID-19 and...boost immunity." He added that last month, India laid the foundation of the WHO centre of traditional medicine in the country with an aim to make this knowledge available to the world.

259.title: Taapsee Pannu-starrer 'Dobaaraa' to release on August 19
259.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu's film 'Dobaaraa' will release on August 19 in theatres. The film, which is directed by Anurag Kashyap, was announced in 2021. Actor Pavail Gulati, who shared the screen with Taapsee in Anubhav Sinha's 'Thappad', also features in the film. This is Anurag and Taapsee's third collaboration after 'Manmarziyaan' and 'Saand Ki Aankh'.

260.title: Centre not releasing MGNREGA, PMAY funds to WB: CM Mamata
260.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday wrote a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, stating that the central government isn't releasing funds to Bengal for MGNREGA and PM Awas Yojana. "In Awas Yojana, West Bengal is Number 1 in the country and from 2016-17, more than 32 lakh houses had been constructed in the state," Banerjee wrote.

261.title: Centre aims to build 18,000 km of highways in FY23: Nitin Gadkari
261.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said on Thursday that Centre aims to build 18,000 km of highways in financial year 2022-23 at a speed of 50 km/day. He added that the government's overall target is to develop 2 lakh km of National Highway Network by 2025. The pace of national highway (NH) construction in India had touched 37 km/day in 2020-21.

262.title: 10-yr-old YouTuber demands ₹3-crore as ransom from doctor, arrested with father in UP
262.article_body: After a caller allegedly threatened to kidnap an Uttarakhand doctor's son and demanded ₹3 crore as ransom, police said they found the caller to be a 10-year-old YouTuber in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur. The police have arrested the boy and his father after putting their phone on electronic surveillance. A police team was also reportedly deployed outside the doctor's hospital.

263.title: Delhivery IPO subscribed 23% on Day 2, retail portion booked 40%
263.article_body: Delhivery's IPO, worth ₹5,235 crore, was subscribed to 23% by the end of Day 2 on Thursday, a 2% above its Day 1 subscription tally. The retail portion saw the highest subscription at 40%, followed by the qualified institutional investors portion at 29%. Meanwhile, the non-institutional buyers portion remained unchanged at 1% subscription.

264.title: Sanctions on Russia won't affect global oil supply: IEA
264.article_body: The International Energy Agency (IEA) said the world won't be left short of oil even with lower output from sanctions-hit Russia. "Steadily rising volumes from...OPEC+ and the US along with a slowdown in demand growth is expected to fend off an acute supply deficit," the IEA said. This comes after it predicted a possible global oil "supply shock" in March.

265.title: CSK's Conway gets out on golden duck as DRS not available due to power issues
265.article_body: CSK opener Devon Conway was dismissed for a golden duck after the on-field umpire adjudged him LBW out off MI's Daniel Sams. Conway couldn't take a review as the facility wasn't available due to power issues in the stadium. After watching the replay, commentator Simon Doull was heard saying, "Oh dear me. It's missing leg [stump] by a long way."

266.title: Global crypto regulation body likely in next year: IOSCO Chair
266.article_body: The International Organisation of Securities Commissions' (IOSCO) Chair Ashley Alder said global market regulators are likely to launch a joint body within the next year to better co-ordinate cryptocurrency rules. "There's a wall of worry about this (crypto)...at an institutional level," Alder stated. He added that the main concerns are cyber security and a lack of transparency, among others.

267.title: Ather Energy raises $128 mn led by state-owned NIIFL, Hero MotoCorp
267.article_body: Ather Energy has raised $128 million in its Series E round of funding, the electric two-wheeler maker said on Thursday. The round was led by India's sovereign wealth fund National Investment and Infrastructure Fund Limited's (NIIFL) Strategic Opportunities Fund (SOF) and Hero MotoCorp, among others. With this investment, the Bengaluru-based company has raised over $230 million financing to date.

268.title: N Korea fires 3 suspected ballistic missiles, 16th weapons test in 2022
268.article_body: North Korea on Thursday fired three suspected short-range ballistic missiles toward the sea off its east coast, the South Korean military said. This is said to be the country's 16th known weapons test this year. The launch came hours after North Korea confirmed its first-ever COVID-19 infection and declared a "serious emergency", with leader Kim Jong-un ordering a national lockdown.

269.title: Cong has capability, leadership to reform from within: Hooda
269.article_body: Senior Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Friday asserted that the party has the capability and the leadership to reform itself from within. On whether demands such as setting up a parliamentary board would be discussed, he said, "Election process is going on, it will be completed in a few months, other things will be looked upon after the election."

270.title: Appeasement politics ends with 100% coverage of govt schemes: PM Modi
270.article_body: Politics of appeasement comes to an end with 100% coverage of government schemes, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Thursday. He was addressing 'Utkarsh Samaroh' in Gujarat, via video conferencing and said, "Due to lack of information about government schemes, they either remain on paper or people not entitled for such schemes take benefit."

271.title: First pic of supermassive black hole at the centre of Milky Way released
271.article_body: Astronomers have unveiled the first image of the supermassive black hole at the centre of the Milky Way galaxy. "The new view captures light bent by the powerful gravity of the black hole, which is four million times more massive than our Sun," astronomers said. The image was produced by a global research team called the Event Horizon Telescope Collaboration.

272.title: Investors lose nearly ₹19 lakh crore in five trading sessions
272.article_body: The wealth of equity investors tumbled by over ₹18.74 lakh crore as the market indices continued to fall for the fifth session on Thursday. While the Sensex plunged 1,158 points to end at 52,930 on Thursday, the Nifty plunged 359 points to settle at 15,808. Markets continued to remain under pressure in sync with the global markets slump, experts said.

273.title: Largest white diamond ever auctioned, larger than a golf ball, sold for $21.9 mn
273.article_body: 'The Rock', the biggest white diamond ever auctioned, was sold for 21,681,000 Swiss francs ($21.9 million) by auction house Christie's in Geneva. The pear-cut diamond of 228.31 carats, larger than a golf ball, was sold by an unnamed owner from North America and was bought by a private collector bidding by telephone. The pre-sale estimate was 19-30 million Swiss francs.

274.title: Meta tells hardware staffers to prepare for cutbacks: Report
274.article_body: Meta is preparing cutbacks in its Reality Labs division, a unit which is part of the company's strategy to refocus on hardware products and the metaverse, Reuters reported citing a spokesperson. Meta Chief Technology Officer Andrew Bosworth on Tuesday said the changes are expected within a week. Meta isn't planning layoffs as part of the changes, the spokesperson added.

275.title: MI to bowl first against CSK in bottom-of-the-table clash, Kieron Pollard dropped
275.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against CSK in the bottom-of-the-table clash in IPL 2022. Bottom-placed MI have dropped Kieron Pollard from their playing XI and have replaced him with Tristan Stubbs. They have also included Hrithik Shokeen in place of Murugan Ashwin. Meanwhile, ninth-placed CSK are fielding the same playing XI.

276.title: It does disappoint: Kiara Advani on role of actresses in comedy films
276.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani, speaking about comedy films, has said, "It's very rare that a female protagonist adds a punch." She added that the character arc of a male protagonist and a female protagonist cannot be compared. "Unfortunately that's how (the script) is written...It definitely does disappoint," Kiara further said. The actress will next be seen in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

277.title: DS Chauhan given additional charge of UP DGP after Mukul Goel's removal
277.article_body: IPS officer and DG Intelligence DS Chauhan has been given the additional charge of Uttar Pradesh Director General of Police (DGP), a day after Mukul Goel was removed from the post for reportedly neglecting his work. Goel has been made the Director General (DG) of the Civil Defence department, as per an official statement. Goel is a 1987-batch IPS officer.

278.title: Got colonial characters in India due to white face: 'RRR' actor Edward
278.article_body: American actor Edward Sonnenblick, who featured in 'RRR', has said, "There was...niche for someone like me in the industry, white faces got colonial characters. That's the majority of roles that come my way." However, he added he does get to play other roles in films like 'Saving Chintu' where he played an American guy trying to adopt a kid.

279.title: Make Tamil official language of Madras HC: TN CM Stalin to PM Modi
279.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin wrote to PM Narendra Modi and Chief Justice NV Ramana on Thursday urging them to fulfil three demands, including making Tamil the official language of Madras HC. Stalin in his letter added that there should be diversity in appointment of judges. Thirdly, he cited the need for setting up permanent regional benches of SC.

280.title: Rishabh Pant has made simple mistakes with his shot selection: Watson
280.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said the team's captain Rishabh Pant has made "simple" mistakes with his shot selection in IPL 2022 so far. "Little things haven't gone Pant's way. A couple of random chop ons out of nowhere," added Watson. "Pant's mindset is to entertain. He would prefer to go down taking the game on than...being defensive," stated Watson.

281.title: Congress stages protest against inflation & unemployment in Bhopal
281.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Youth Congress staged a protest against the BJP government in Madhya Pradesh regarding issues like inflation, corruption and unemployment in Bhopal. Congress State President Kamal Nath was also present during the protest and the protesters marched towards CM's residence, raising slogans against the government. The police used water cannons on the protesting Congress workers.

282.title: Attempt to get publicity: Pawar on Patole's 'backstabber' remark
282.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM and NCP leader Ajit Pawar criticised Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole's "backstabber" comment and said that it was an "attempt to get publicity". He said, "We know from which party he has come. Does that mean he has stabbed someone?" Earlier, Patole called NCP a backstabber after they joined hands with BJP during Gondia Zilla Parishad elections.

283.title: Muslims being harassed in BJP regime: BSP Supremo Mayawati
283.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) Supremo Mayawati criticised the Yogi Adityanath-led BJP government in Uttar Pradesh and claimed that Muslims were being harassed in BJP-ruled states. In a series of tweets, Mayawati accused the Uttar Pradesh government of harassing political opponents. She also condemned the government for keeping SP leader Azam Khan in jail for about two-and-a-half years.

284.title: Ukraine to put first Russian soldier on trial for war crimes: Report
284.article_body: Amid Russia's ongoing invasion, Ukraine to put the first Russian soldier on trial for war crimes, DW quoted Ukraine's top prosecutor Iryna Venediktova as saying. Vadim Shishimarin, a 21-year-old Russian soldier, will reportedly face the trial for killing an unarmed 62-year-old man in Ukraine. Shishimarin could face fifteen years imprisonment on charges of war crimes and premeditated murder.

285.title: India's industrial output rises from 1.5% in Feb to 1.9% in Mar
285.article_body: India's industrial output, measured in terms of the Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a growth of 1.9% in March, up from 1.5% in February. This comes after data released on April 29 showed output of India's eight core sectors grew 4.3% YoY in March 2022, down from 6% in February 2022. The eight sectors account for 40.3% of IIP.

286.title: Ranil Wickremesinghe takes oath as new PM of crisis-hit Sri Lanka
286.article_body: Ranil Wickremesinghe, an opposition lawmaker, has been sworn in as the new Prime Minister of Sri Lanka by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa amid political and economic crisis in the country. This comes days after former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa quit his post and went to an undisclosed location with his family amid protests in the island nation.

287.title: SRK-led Knight Riders Group acquires Abu Dhabi franchise in UAE's T20 League
287.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan-led Knight Riders Group has acquired the Abu Dhabi franchise in UAE's T20 League.  "We're excited about becoming part of UAE’s T20 League, which no doubt will become hugely successful," Shah Rukh said. As many as six teams will compete in UAE's T20 League. Reliance Industries Limited also owns a team in the league.

288.title: India needs a stronger Oppn: Spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
288.article_body: Spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravi Shankar said that India needs a "stronger Opposition" and called the current Opposition "weak". He said, "Lack of leadership in the Opposition can make any democracy appear not as a democracy." He added, "West Bengal has shown that with free-and-fair elections, no party can meddle with the institutions of India."

289.title: Indian Army to buy 12 Swathi weapon-locating radars for China border
289.article_body: The Indian Army has put up a proposal to the Defence Ministry for buying 12 'Swathi' weapon-locating radars developed by DRDO. Swathi weapon-locating radars provide fast, automatic and accurate location of enemy weapons like mortars, shells and rockets within 50-kilometre range. The Army has been using the radars for its operations along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir.

290.title: Need action against those who filed sedition cases due to pressure: BJP MP
290.article_body: BJP MP from Mumbai North, Gopal Shetty, said on Wednesday that strong action must be taken against those officials who have filed sedition cases against individuals "under pressure". Shetty's comments come as SC has permitted the Centre to re-examine the provisions of Section 124A of IPC that criminalises sedition. Over 300 sedition cases have been filed since 2014.

291.title: Biden administration has taken Quad to leader level: White House
291.article_body: White House on Wednesday said that the US President Joe Biden-led US administration has taken the Quad to the leader level. "We are the first administration that has taken the Quad- that is the United States, Australia, India, and Japan- to the leader level," a senior administration official said. His remarks came on the eve of the US-ASEAN Special Summit.

292.title: Mumbai is at flood risk again: AAP as it criticises BMC
292.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party accused the Mumbai civic body BMC of shoddy pre-monsoon work and said Mumbai is at flood risk again. AAP demanded an external independent body to be appointed to audit the pre-monsoon preparation of BMC. "The Shiv Sena government has shown complete apathy to death and devastation caused in Mumbai year after year," AAP Mumbai president said.

293.title: BJP-led Centre may amend sedition law instead of revoking it: Moitra
293.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Thursday said the BJP-led Centre is "not keen on revoking the draconian legislation (sedition law)" and may instead amend it. This comes a day after the Supreme Court put the sedition law on hold. "Had the Centre been serious in reconsidering the law, it could have done it in the last eight years," she added.

294.title: Can't do 'Koffee With Karan' but can do 'Tea with Twinkle', jokes Twinkle
294.article_body: Actress-turned-writer Twinkle Khanna took to Instagram and shared a photo of herself with a cup and rollers on her hair. "Can't do 'Koffee with Karan' again but 'Tea with Twinkle' may not be a bad idea after all," she captioned her post. Twinkle appeared on the show, hosted by Karan Johar, with her husband Akshay Kumar in season five.

295.title: Another internet shutdown in Raj after attack on VHP leader
295.article_body: Mobile internet services were suspended and communal tension gripped Rajasthan's Nohar town after VHP leader Satveer Saharan was attacked by some people, officials said on Thursday. Saharan was attacked on Wednesday evening when he, along with others, objected to a group of people sitting on a vacant plot next to a temple and creating a nuisance.

296.title: UP govt makes singing national anthem mandatory in all state madrasas
296.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has made it mandatory for students and teachers to sing the national anthem before starting classes in all madrasas of the state. The order has been implemented from May 12 (Thursday). UP Cabinet Minister Danish Azad said, "When the national anthem is sung, students would learn society's values."

297.title: Garbage collectors return bag with jewellery & cash in Navi Mumbai
297.article_body: Two garbage collectors returned a bag with gold jewellery, cash and a mobile phone to its owners after they found it during garbage collection in Navi Mumbai's Uran. The owner of the bag, Sushali Dhananjay Nakhwa, a fish seller, lost it while he was going to hospital. The garbage collectors found the bag, approached the police and returned it.

298.title: Can't get married as rumours are spread that I beat up boys: Kangana
298.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, in an interview with RJ Siddharth Kannan, was asked if she is like her character in 'Dhaakad' in real life. To this, she replied, "Who will I beat up in real life? I'm unable to get married because of people like you spreading these rumours." "Rumours are spread about me that I beat up boys," she added.

299.title: Korean in Gurugram hits cook with pressure cooker for missing train
299.article_body: A Korean resident of Gurugram allegedly beat his Nepali cook for missing the train to his home, police said on Wednesday. The complainant said that he took leave from May 10 to go to his country, but missed his train. His employer beat him with a pressure cooker lid when he went back, the complainant said, according to the police.

300.title: Mumbai to get a single planning authority: Aaditya Thackeray
300.article_body: Deliberations are being held to set up a single planning authority headed by an "empowered" mayor for Mumbai, Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray said on Thursday. Project implementation will remain with existing agencies such as Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority. "To repair one footpath...there are 42 utilities and coordination is required for each one," Thackeray said.

301.title: Biker falls on road as car driver abruptly opens door in Hyd; video surfaces
301.article_body: A man riding a bike fell on the road after the driver of a parked car abruptly opened the door in Hyderabad. The Cyberabad Traffic Police has shared a video of the incident that shows people running to help the man on the bike. "Always use your furthest hand to open the door," the police said.

302.title: India's retail inflation surges to 7.79% in April, highest in 8 years
302.article_body: India's retail inflation surged to 7.79% in April 2022, the highest since May 2014, data released by the government on Thursday showed. At 7.79%, the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation for April is higher than the March number of 6.95%. Earlier this month, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das had said inflation was "expected to be elevated" in April.

303.title: You don't work for it: Arjun on being generation's 1st actor to cross ₹100-cr mark
303.article_body: On being asked about being first actor from his generation to have crossed ₹100-crore mark, actor Arjun Kapoor said, "Yes I was the first (actor of my generation) to cross the ₹100-crore mark but that's not something you work for. You work for making films that continuously do well. The numbers evolve. Phases happen in an actor's life."

304.title: ED raids premises of former Odisha MLA, seizes FDs worth over ₹133 crore
304.article_body: Enforcement Directorate has carried out raids at various premises linked to former Odisha MLA Jitendra Nath Patnaik in a money laundering case linked to alleged illegal mining. "A seizure of cash amounting to ₹70 lakh and 124 fixed deposits amounting to ₹133.17 crore has been made," the ED said. Patnaik is a former independent MLA from the Champua Assembly constituency.

305.title: Thane Police allegedly extort ₹6 crore from toy trader, 10 officers suspended
305.article_body: Ten policemen who were attached with Mumbra police station under Thane City Police Commissionerate have been suspended after they allegedly extorted ₹6 crore from toy trader and builder, Faisal Memon, last month. Reports said police claimed they had tip-off about unaccounted cash with Memon. A complainant, Shaikh Ibrahim, said police forcibly took ₹6 crore from Memon to suppress the case.

306.title: Woman receives head injuries in leopard attack, 4th incident in 3 days
306.article_body: A 45-year-old woman received severe head injuries after being attacked by a leopard in Pune's Khed taluka on Thursday. This is the fourth such attack in the last three days. Three people, including two women, were injured in three separate incidents of leopard attack in Khed and Ambegaon talukas on Tuesday night and Wednesday morning.

307.title: Over $200 billion wiped off cryptocurrency market in 24 hours
307.article_body: More than $200 billion of wealth was wiped out from the cryptocurrency market in just 24 hours amid a massive sell-off, Bloomberg reported on Thursday citing CoinMarketCap data. The crypto plunge was driven by the collapse of the TerraUSD stablecoin. The plunge affected major tokens and Bitcoin plunged by as much as 10% to its lowest level since December 2020.

308.title: Kashmiri Pandit shot dead by terrorists in J&K
308.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit, identified as Rahul Bhat, was shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Budgam district in what is said to be an instance of a targeted attack. "Terrorists fired upon one employee namely Shri Rahul Bhat from minority community in Tehsildar office, Chadoora," Kashmir Police said. He was hospitalised after the attack but succumbed to his injuries.

309.title: Pune boy who was locked with 20 dogs needs mental health evaluation: Experts
309.article_body: After the parents of an 11-year-old boy allegedly confined him to his house in Pune with more than 20 dogs, experts say that the boy and his parents need extensive mental health evaluation. "Helping the child get back into the mainstream is vital," a child and adolescent psychiatrist said. The boy has been rescued and sent to a shelter home.

310.title: Finland joining NATO is definite threat to us: Russia
310.article_body: The Kremlin on Thursday said Finland's move to join NATO was "definitely" a threat to Russia and threatened an unspecified response. The expansion of the US-led military alliance "does not make our continent [Europe] more stable and secure", Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. Finland, which shares a 1,300-kilometre  border with Russia, has joined "unfriendly steps" against Russia, he added.

311.title: I'm mortified, have a lot of anxiety; won't watch 'Doctor Strange..': Elizabeth
311.article_body: Actress Elizabeth Olsen, when asked about being leading lady in a blockbuster movie, said that she is mortified and has a lot of anxiety about 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. She added she will not be watching the movie and that she is facing such pressure for the first time. "I've never...had to lead...commercial film...by myself," she added.

312.title: BJP is diverting people's attention from real issues: Sachin Pilot
312.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Thursday accused the BJP of diverting people's attention from the real issues. He said, "There is chaos in the fiscal management and the economic policies of the government have been a monumental failure and there is no accountability in the government." His remarks came before the party's "Nav Sankalp Chintan Shivir" in Udaipur.

313.title: 26,650 Russian soldiers killed, 1,195 enemy tanks destroyed: Ukraine
313.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Ministry on Thursday claimed that about 26,650 Russian soldiers have been killed since the Russian invasion began on February 24. Ukraine forces have destroyed 1,195 Russian tanks and 360 aircraft, including 161 helicopters, the ministry added. Ukraine also claimed to have destroyed 2,873 armoured personnel carriers, 534 artillery systems and 191 multiple launch rocket systems.

314.title: SUGAR Cosmetics looks to double revenue, expand to 60,000 stores
314.article_body: D2C beauty brand SUGAR Cosmetics is targeting to double its gross revenues to ₹600 crore in FY23 and achieve net revenue of over ₹500 crore, CEO Vineeta Singh said. The Shark Tank India judge added that the brand's looking to expand its offline presence to over 60,000 stores in the next 12-15 months. Currently, it's available in about 30,000 outlets.

315.title: NDRF conducts field trials of unmanned vehicles, gadgets in Pune
315.article_body: The National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) conducted field trials of unmanned aerial and marine vehicles and other modern gadgets on May 10 and 11 at headquarters of 5th Battalion at Sudumbare in Pune. As many as 10 firms showcased their equipment that can be used in disaster relief operations. The exhibited technologies included drone-based aerial mapping and advanced image analytics.

316.title: I want to steal Djokovic's elasticity, Nadal's self-sacrifice: Alcaraz
316.article_body: Spain's Carlos Alcaraz said he wants to steal Novak Djokovic's elasticity and physique as well as Roger Federer's elegance. "I would steal Rafael Nadal's fighting spirit, self-sacrifice, work ethic. If I have to train three hours, I train at 200 percent intensity," added Alcaraz. "I want to continue climbing...If it can be to heaven, even better," stated Alcaraz.

317.title: Don't pick up call & ask 'Should I work on particular project': Nazia on Sanjay
317.article_body: Actress Nazia Hussain, who is the grand daughter of actor Sanjay Dutt's maternal uncle, said that she does not pick up the call and ask the actor if she should be taking up particular projects. "When you are related to someone who's such a big star, it's constantly like 'Am I going to be good enough'," she added.

318.title: US' Arizona carries out 1st execution in 8 years
318.article_body: US' Arizona on Wednesday carried out its first execution since 2014, putting to death a prisoner convicted of killing a 21-year-old student 44 years ago. Clarence Dixon, convicted of stabbing and strangling of Arizona State University student Deana Bowdoin in 1978, was executed by lethal injection. Dixon is the sixth person to be executed in US this year.

319.title: Muslim cleric insults Class 10 girl on stage in Kerala; Guv criticises him
319.article_body: A Muslim cleric allegedly scolded organisers of an event for inviting a Class 10 girl student on stage to receive an award in Kerala's Malappuram district. Governor Arif Mohammed Khan has criticised the cleric for humiliating the girl student. The Governor said, "I am so deeply disappointed that the whole political leadership is silent about it."

320.title: AAP MLA detained for protesting anti-encroachment drive in south Delhi
320.article_body: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan and his supporters, who were protesting against an anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Madanpur Khadar area, were detained on Thursday. "I am ready to go to jail if it saves the houses of poor people. There is no encroachment here. I will support them in demolition if there is any encroachment," said Amanatullah.

321.title: Are we here to decide who built Taj Mahal?: HC on PIL seeking to open Taj Mahal rooms
321.article_body: While rejecting a petition seeking to open 22 closed doors in Taj Mahal, Allahabad High Court asked the petitioner, "Are we here to decide who built Taj Mahal?" The court said, "Please don't take us to the historical facts which you believe." It added that such debates are for drawing rooms, not for a court of law.

322.title: Man gets fake wife to donate kidney in Pune; she reveals identity on not getting ₹15 lakh
322.article_body: Fifteen people have been booked over an alleged kidney racket after a woman was promised ₹15 lakh to pose as the wife of a man who needed a transplant. She donated her kidney to a young woman and in turn, the young woman's mother donated her kidney to the man. The woman revealed her real identity after dispute over money.

323.title: Canada to fly in about 900 Ukrainian refugees from Poland
323.article_body: Canada will reportedly bring in about 900 Ukrainian refugees from Poland between late May and early June. The country is going to arrange three flights from Poland's Warsaw to three of its cities - Winnipeg on May 23, Montreal on May 29 and Halifax on June 2. In March, Canada allowed the Ukrainian refugees to stay for three years.

324.title: Cong will have to remain pivot of anti-BJP formation for 2024 polls: Pilot
324.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said Congress is and will have to remain the "pivot" around which an anti-BJP coalition is formed to take on the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "A UPA plus plus formation might be the best one to take on the NDA," Pilot added. "Don't forget NDA has lost many partners since 2019," Pilot stated.

325.title: Cong to introspect strengths, weaknesses during 'Chintan Shivir': Surjewala
325.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala on Thursday said the party will introspect its strengths and weaknesses during its 'Chintan Shivir'. "Considering...current challenges and situations, our efficiency and skills are not only important to evaluate but bring changes to them as well," he said. Surjewala further stated inflation, unemployment and increasing debt as reasons for holding the session.

326.title: 4 killed, several injured as car overturns after hitting divider in J'khand
326.article_body: Four people died and several others were injured on Thursday after their car hit a road divider and overturned in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharsawan district. According to an official, the victims were going to Urmal village after attending a wedding ceremony in Ramgarh area of the district. Three persons were killed on the spot while one died during treatment, the official added.

327.title: 4 killed in suicide blast ahead of presidential vote in Somalia
327.article_body: At least four people were reportedly killed in a suicide blast in Somalia's capital Mogadishu on Wednesday. "I saw four people dead at the scene. Two of them were government soldiers who died immediately after the attack," said a police officer. This comes days ahead of the presidential election that is set to take place on Sunday.

328.title: China's engagement with South Pacific countries no threat to Aus: Envoy
328.article_body: China's Ambassador to Australia Xiao Qian has said that the former's engagement with South Pacific countries is conducive to regional stability and isn't a threat to Australia's security. Qian's comments come amid concerns by Australia about a potential Chinese military presence in the Solomon Islands following a bilateral security deal. China and Solomon Islands signed the pact in April.

329.title: Been a 22-day rigorous struggle to get mom out of hospital: Urvashi Dholakia
329.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia shared the reason for her absence on social media and said she was taking care of her ailing mother. Taking to Instagram Story, Urvashi wrote, "[It has] been a 22-day rigorous struggle to get mom out of the hospital but now she is back home. The struggle though isn't over as tremendous care has to be taken."

330.title: Director had options but he backed his casting of Alia & me: Arjun on 2 States
330.article_body: As Arjun Kapoor completed 10 years in Bollywood on May 11, he celebrated it by conducting an 'ask me anything' session on Instagram. During the session, one of his fans wrote, "'2 States' is...one of my favourite films." In response, Arjun said, "Our director Abhishek Verman...backed his casting of @aliabhatt and me when he had many options to choose from."

331.title: Hindu Rashtra doesn't mean others can't practice faith: Haryana BJP MLA
331.article_body: BJP MLA from Haryana's Ambala City Aseem Goel said Hindu Rashtra (country) doesn't mean asking people of other religions to stop practicing their faith. "Isn't it justified for a country with 100 crore Hindus to call for a nation for which our ancestors sacrificed their lives for centuries?" Goel said. He had recently pledged to make "Hindustan a Hindu Rashtra".

332.title: Actress Chhavi Mittal shares pic showing her scar after breast cancer surgery
332.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal took to Instagram to share a picture showing her scar, days after her breast cancer surgery. "I did the unthinkable! I went to the gym today...I could do squats, lunges, Bulgarian split squats, calf raises, single-leg squats and sumo squats," she wrote. "I even got to sport my scar on the armpit while at it," she added.

333.title: I've been raped multiple times because I was too drunk to say 'Stop': Actress Selma Blair
333.article_body: Hollywood actress Selma Blair stated in her memoir that she has been raped multiple times while being drunk. "I was too drunk to say the words 'Please. Stop'," she wrote. "I came out of each event quiet and ashamed," she added. She revealed she was once raped after a day of binge-drinking during a college spring break trip.

334.title: Chhattisgarh Ranji captain Harpreet booked in govt job cheating case
334.article_body: Chhattisgarh's Ranji Trophy team captain Harpreet Singh Bhatia has been booked for cheating and forgery after allegedly getting a government job in the office of Principal Accountant General (Audit) Chhattisgarh by submitting bogus documents. Harpreet had submitted a BCom degree certificate from Bundelkhand University, however, officials found that no such marksheet had been issued.

335.title: Felt that my kiss with Dharmendra was out of the box: Nafisa on Life In A Metro
335.article_body: When asked about the pre-climax scene in film 'Life In A Metro', where Nafisa Ali and Dharmendra share a kiss, the veteran actress replied, "When you are an actor, you have to portray whatever is required from your character. I felt...(the kiss) was out of the box and provided shock value." "Two old people don't...kiss in Hindi movies," she said.

336.title: Once Marsh gets going, he's one of the best T20 batters in the world: Watson
336.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said Mitchell Marsh is "one of the best T20 batters in the world" when he gets going. "It took Marsh a few games to get going...after the COVID-19 setback...[but] he adds a lot of value," added Watson. Marsh scored 89(62) to help DC chase down RR's 160-run total. Currently, DC are fifth on IPL standings.

337.title: Karnataka to bring anti-conversion ordinance: CM Bommai
337.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said the Cabinet is likely to approve the ordinance move for the anti-conversion bill in its cabinet meeting on Thursday. This comes after the state assembly passed an anti-conversion bill prohibiting conversion from one religion to another by "misrepresentation, force, fraud, allurement or marriage" in December amid Opposition protests.

338.title: 3 UP revenue dept officials among 4 booked for forging land records
338.article_body: Four persons, including three revenue department officials, have been booked for forging land records in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Thursday. The complainant, who claimed to own a property, alleged that it had been fraudulently registered in the name of another person. An FIR was registered against four people, including a revenue clerk officer and two accountants, police added.

339.title: Russia demands apology from Poland over red paint attack on envoy
339.article_body: Russia has demanded an "official apology" from Poland after Moscow's ambassador to Warsaw was doused with red paint by anti-war protesters. "A decision on further steps will be taken depending on Warsaw's reaction to our demands," Russia's Foreign Ministry said. Protesters attacked Sergey Andreev on Monday as he arrived to honour Red Army troops who died during Second World War.

340.title: Ramkrishna, Subramanian's bail pleas in NSE scam case rejected
340.article_body: A Delhi court on Thursday dismissed the bail pleas filed by NSE's ex-CEO Chitra Ramkrishna and ex-Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian in connection with the co-location scam case. The CBI told the court that the accused, holding influential positions, could tamper with the evidence and must be kept in custody. Ramkrishna has been accused of frequently revising Subramanian's designation.

341.title: Child sandwiched between parents on scooter motivated me to build Nano: Tata
341.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata took to Instagram to share a picture of him with Tata Nano, the compact car that he launched in 2008. "What really motivated me...was constantly seeing Indian families on scooters, maybe the child sandwiched between the mother and father," Tata wrote on building Nano. "Nano was always meant for all our people," he added.

342.title: Need to create more districts in West Bengal: Mamata Banerjee
342.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said the state needs to be divided into more districts to accelerate the process of development. "We need to divide the districts as these are very large. The state will have more districts. This will help expedite development work," she said. For this, the state needs more manpower and infrastructure, she added.

343.title: Karnataka cabinet approves anti-conversion bill as ordinance: Home Minister
343.article_body: Karnataka cabinet has approved the anti-conversion bill and it will be discussed in the next Assembly session, the state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said. Till then, the ordinance will be in place, he added. "Because the Assembly and Council got prorogued, we're placing a proposal to promulgate an ordinance in the cabinet," CM Basavaraj Bommai had said before the meeting.

344.title: AAP has done nothing: BJP to start campaign to ‘expose’ Delhi govt
344.article_body: BJP's Delhi unit has announced a 'Pol Khol' door-to-door campaign from 15-30 May in the national capital. The party workers will meet over 25 lakh families during the campaign and inform them about AAP government's failures citing 10 key points like unemployment, health, education, etc. "Kejriwal government has done nothing except making tall claims," Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said.

345.title: We are trying for perfect implementation of all govt schemes: Goa CM
345.article_body: Goa Chief Minister Dr Pramod Sawant on Thursday said, "We are trying for a perfect implementation of all govt schemes." He assured that schemes related to housing, sanitation, electricity, social and financial security, equipment for Divyang, Kisan credit among others will be made available to all. "In third tenure of BJP...roads, tourism, medical...development have been taken up," he added.

346.title: 3 killed, 18 injured after vehicle turns upside down in Chhattisgarh
346.article_body: At least three people were killed and 18 were injured after a vehicle turned upside down near Dhodhoi Chowk in Chhattisgarh's Rajnandgaon district, police said on Thursday. The accident took place when the driver decided to take the vehicle off-road after spotting a cattle. The vehicle was carrying around 20-25 people who were returning from a wedding ceremony in Panchdewari.

347.title: Salman offers condolences to brother-in-law Aayush on his grandfather's death
347.article_body: Actor Salman Khan offered his condolences to his brother-in-law Aayush Sharma after his grandfather, former politician Pandit Sukh Ram Sharma's death. Sharing a photo of Aayush's grandfather on Instagram, Salman wrote, "Sending my heartfelt condolences to Aayush...on the loss of his grandfather Shri Sukhram ji today." The former Union Minister reportedly suffered a brain stroke.

348.title: Gang members hurl Molotov cocktails at police in TN; 5 arrested
348.article_body: Tamil Nadu Police on Thursday arrested five members of a gang for allegedly hurling Molotov cocktails at the police at an abandoned petroleum refinery in Cuddalore. On Wednesday morning, police visited the refinery after being informed that the gang had engaged in the theft of scrap materials.
