Seeing the police, the accused hurled Molotov cocktails and fled the spot.

349.title: 2 men, who illegally entered India, held in B'luru for stealing bikes
349.article_body: Bengaluru City Police on Thursday arrested two men on charges of stealing bikes and recovered eight bikes from their possession. According to police, the two men illegally crossed over to India in 2018 after a Bangladesh court sentenced them to five years of imprisonment in an assault case. Meanwhile, authorities have begun the process to deport the accused to Bangladesh.

350.title: Video shows woman slipping from train in Odisha, RPF constable saves her
350.article_body: A Railway Protection Force (RPF) head constable pulled a woman to safety after she slipped from a moving train at Bhubaneswar Railway Station on Wednesday. Reports said she was trying to deboard the train. In a video shared by IPS officer Dr Sudhanshu Sarangi, the woman can be seen losing balance and falling off the moving train.

351.title: People living in Mumbai don't need UP 'embassy': Maha Min Jayant Patil
351.article_body: Maharashtra Minister and NCP leader Jayant Patil said people living in Mumbai don't need a UP 'embassy' or office. His remarks came after Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath announced the decision to set up an office in Mumbai to establish contact with UP natives in the city. Patil claimed it is being done ahead of BMC polls.

352.title: Sachin Bansal's Navi appoints Meesho Founder as independent director
352.article_body: Sachin Bansal's Navi has appointed social commerce platform Meesho Founder Vidit Aatrey as an independent director on its board. The company now has four independent directors on its board, forming a majority. Navi recently also appointed three other independent directors. The other board members include Bansal and former Deputy Governor of the Reserve Bank of India Anand Sinha.

353.title: Leopard found dead near a tea stall in Tamil Nadu
353.article_body: A leopard was found dead in Varattuparai in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore on Thursday. According to Anamalai Tiger Reserve (ATR) officials, the animal's right foreleg was trapped in a henhouse behind the tea shop. "The animal could have died of shock after getting its foreleg stuck in the mesh of the henhouse while trying to catch chicken," an official said.

354.title: He was set to sign a new Barca contract: PSG's Paredes on teammate Messi
354.article_body: PSG midfielder Leo Paredes said his team's forward Lionel Messi was going to sign a new contract with Barcelona having arranged everything, before suddenly opting to join PSG instead. "I don't know what happened on that trip to Barcelona because the same night he was going to sign the contract, Messi told us he was coming here," added Paredes.

355.title: 4 CBI officers held for conducting fake raid to extort money in Chandigarh
355.article_body: The Chandigarh Police arrested four CBI officers for allegedly conducting a fake raid on an IT firm to extort money, officials said. On Wednesday, the accused allegedly went to Chandigarh to conduct a "search" even when they are not posted there and had no case or mandate for such an operation, the officials added.

356.title: Elections in Pak will only be held after poll reforms: Ex-Prez Zardari
356.article_body: Ex-Pakistani President Asif Ali Zardari has said that elections in the country will only be held after the introduction of poll reforms. "We have to change laws and improve them and then go to elections," he said. Former PM Imran Khan recently called for expedited polls in Pakistan after being ousted from power via a no-trust vote last month.

357.title: Go and research, do MA, PhD: Allahabad HC to man seeking opening of Taj Mahal rooms
357.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has dismissed a plea seeking opening of certain rooms of the Taj Mahal. "Go and research. Do MA. Do PhD. Then choose such a topic and if any institute disallows you to research then come to us," the court told the petitioner. The petitioner contends that Taj Mahal was a Shiva Temple, known as Tejo Mahalaya.

358.title: Tantrums, abuse weren't allowed in our house; kids could express: Priyanka's mom
358.article_body: Priyanka Chopra's mother Madhu Chopra said that even though their household was liberal, there were certain limitations. "Tantrums were never allowed, raised voices were never allowed, abuse was never allowed. With these things banned, they could express themselves," she added. She also said they used to discuss what happened in Priyanka and Siddharth's school and shared advice on it.

359.title: Mehbooba raising communal frenzy for petty political gains: BJP
359.article_body: Responding to Mehbooba Mufti's remarks on the economy, Jammu and Kashmir BJP chief spokesperson Sunil Sethi said that she was raising communal frenzy for petty political gains and to provoke people. He added that Mufti's tweets indicate her frustration with the growth of India as a world leader and the destructive situation existing in Pakistan, whose economy is in shambles.

360.title: Ford drops plans to make EVs for exports in India
360.article_body: Ford Motor has dropped plans to make electric vehicles (EVs) in India for exports. "After careful review, we have decided to no longer pursue EV manufacturing for exports from any of the Indian plants," a spokesperson said. In September 2021, Ford had announced it would cease local manufacturing in India, citing an operating loss of $2 billion over 10 years.

361.title: Laughter Champions to replace Kapil Sharma Show during US tour: Report
361.article_body: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' will reportedly be replaced by 'Laughter Champions' as comedian Kapil Sharma and his team will be on a US tour in June. The show will be judged by Archana Puran Singh and Shekhar Suman. A source told The Indian Express, "With no stand-up comedy show at the moment, the team decided to launch one."

362.title: B'luru locals write to MLA after being stranded for 20 hrs due to flooding
362.article_body: Residents of Rainbow Drive Layout in Bengaluru's Sarjapur have written a letter to Mahadevapura MLA Aravind Limbavali, seeking a solution to flooding problems. In the letter, they claimed that "due to major flooding on May 5 they were left stranded for over 20 hours without any access to medical help". Reportedly, they'd already written to BBMP, but to no avail.

363.title: Sensex crashes 1,158 points to close at 52,930 in the 5th-straight session of fall
363.article_body: Sensex fell for the fifth-straight day on Thursday, crashing 1,158 points to close at 52,930, while Nifty closed 359 points lower at 15,808. The market indices dropped over 2%, dragged by banking, financial and metal stocks amid worries over April inflation data and a decline in global stocks. Adani Ports, IndusInd Bank and Tata Steel were among the top losers.

364.title: Pune boy confined to house with dogs shifted to observation home
364.article_body: The 11-year-old boy who was allegedly confined in an apartment with 22 stray dogs by his parents in Pune's Kondhwa has been shifted to an observation home. Arrangements are being made to provide proper treatment and counselling to the minor, Child Welfare Committee (CWC) member Beena Hirekar said. The boy was reportedly kept with dogs for almost two years.

365.title: Elections to 57 Rajya Sabha seats to be held on June 10
365.article_body: The Election Commission of India on Thursday announced that the elections to 57 Rajya Sabha seats spread across 15 states will take place on June 10. As many as 11 seats are in Uttar Pradesh while six each are in Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu. The votes will be counted on the same day.

366.title: Can't attend my only brother's marriage due to tournaments: Record holder hurdler Jyothi
366.article_body: Jyothi Yarraji, who on Tuesday became the fastest Indian woman to run 100-metre hurdles, said that she won't be able to attend her only brother's marriage later this month due to tournaments. "I have hardly attended any family functions. I haven’t been home on festivals and I miss going out like my friends," the 22-year-old added.

367.title: Delete 'negative' posts within 24 hrs: Ola Electric's reply to customer's legal notice
367.article_body: Ola Electric, in response to Guwahati-based customer Balwant Singh's legal notice, asked him to delete negative comments against the company on social media and to stop making defamatory statements against the company. It warned Singh of action if the demands aren't met within 24 hours. Singh had demanded takedown of his son's scooter's telemetry data published publicly by Ola Electric.

368.title: Tomorrow you'll want to open judges' chambers: HC on plea to open Taj Mahal rooms
368.article_body: The Allahabad High Court on Thursday, while hearing a plea seeking to open closed rooms in the Taj Mahal, asked, "Tomorrow will you come and ask to go to the chambers of Honourable Judges?" The court also asked the petitioner to not make a mockery of the PIL system. The petitioner contends that the Taj Mahal was a Shiva temple.

369.title: Campbell Wilson appointed CEO and MD of Air India
369.article_body: Tata Sons has appointed Campbell Wilson as the new CEO and MD of Air India. "It's an honour to be selected to lead the iconic Air India. It's at the cusp of an exciting journey to become one of the best airlines," Wilson said. The 50-year-old New Zealand-born executive recently resigned as CEO of Singapore Airlines budget carrier Scoot.

370.title: HC allows Xiaomi conditional access to seized ₹5,551 cr: Report
370.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has declined to reinstate a freeze on ₹5,551 crore belonging to Chinese smartphone-maker Xiaomi, Hindustan Times reported citing Reuters. The funds were seized by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with "illegal outward remittances" but the seizure was stayed after Xiaomi appealed. The Court also allowed Xiaomi to use a bank overdraft facility to make payments.

371.title: Apple may drop iPhone Lightning port for USB-C in 2023: Report
371.article_body: Apple is planning to switch from the Lightning port on its iPhones to USB-C port in 2023, analyst Ming-Chi Kuo reported. He said that adopting USB-C "could improve iPhone's transfer and charging speed in hardware designs, but the final specification details still depend on iOS support." The EU had earlier proposed mandatory USB-C port on all devices, including iPhones.

372.title: Traffic disrupted after truck overturns on Delhi-Jaipur highway in Gurugram
372.article_body: Traffic remained disrupted in Gurugram after two trucks broke through the median and overturned on the main carriageway at Delhi-Jaipur NH-48 on Thursday. No casualties or injuries were reported in the incident. The concerned teams successfully removed the truck from the road. Gurugram Police also tweeted a video showing clear roads after the traffic got back to normal.

373.title: Lake activist booked over social media posts against B'luru civic body
373.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike has filed a complaint against lake activist Sandeep Anirudhan for spreading propaganda against BBMP officials and inciting people against a road project through social media posts. Anirudhan has claimed that the road project falls in the buffer zone of the Pattandur Agrahara Lake. However, BBMP has refuted his claims, alleging that he has a personal agenda.

374.title: Goa resort's room attendant rapes 12-yr-old Russian girl in pool, then in room
374.article_body: The Goa Police have arrested a man from his home town in neighbouring Karnataka for allegedly raping a 12-year-old Russian girl at a resort in Arambol in North Goa, where he worked as a room attendant. The girl's mother told police that her daughter was sexually assaulted in the swimming pool of the resort and later inside resort's room.

375.title: PM once stopped an important meeting and told staff to feed a hungry peacock: Shah
375.article_body: During an event to launch a book on PM Narendra Modi's political journey, Home Minister Amit Shah said that PM Modi once stopped an important meeting and told staff to feed a hungry peacock. "To think about a peacock while engaged in such a serious meeting shows how sensitive he is," Shah added.

376.title: Legally, a sex worker can say no, not married woman: Delhi HC judge on marital rape
376.article_body: While delivering a verdict on marital rape case, Delhi High Court judge Justice Rajiv Shakdher on Wednesday said, "[A] sex worker has been invested with the power to say 'no' by the law, but not a married woman." He had held the exception to Section 375 of IPC, which exempts forced sexual intercourse by a man with his wife, unconstitutional.

377.title: My mami has every right to slap me: Krushna on Govinda's wife Sunita
377.article_body: Speaking about his uncle Govinda and his wife Sunita, comedian-actor Krushna Abhishek said, "My mama is my blood but I don't share the same blood with my mami. But she let us stay with them for 7-8 years." "She loved me so much and that's why she has every right to scold me. She can slap me," he added.

378.title: Take responsibility, bat at no. 3 or no. 4: Gavaskar on Sanju Samson
378.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said RR captain Sanju Samson should take responsibility of batting at number three or number four, being a number four batter. Discussing Samson's six off four balls against DC, Gavaskar stated, "Samson suddenly found that because RR hadn't got the [required] start, he got to start playing...shots from the word go. In that attempt, he perished."

379.title: Upset over her 13 yrs long divorce case, Odisha woman tries killing self
379.article_body: A woman, who is a lawyer in Odisha's Balasore Court and has been fighting her divorce case for 13 years, tried to kill herself over slow progress of her case, her lawyer said. She was rushed to a hospital. Her condition is said to be stable. Reports said that she complained about monthly maintenance payments by her husband being irregular.

380.title: 37-yr-old man beaten up with sticks for molesting 13-yr-old in Delhi
380.article_body: A 37-year-old married man allegedly molested a 13-year-old girl when she was on her way to her tuition class in Delhi, following which he was beaten up by her parents and a group of men with stones and sticks. He was rescued by a beat officer patrolling the area and was arrested later. The accused man has three children.

381.title: IAS officer Pooja Singhal suspended by Jharkhand govt after being arrested by ED
381.article_body: Jharkhand government has suspended State Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal in connection with a money laundering case linked to alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds. The IAS officer was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on Wednesday. A viral video earlier showed over ₹17 crore in cash being recovered during a raid at the house of a CA linked to her.

382.title: Russia 'most direct threat' to world order, its pact with China worrying: EU
382.article_body: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen said that Russia "is today the most direct threat to the world order with the barbaric war against Ukraine and its worrying pact with China". The remarks came after her meeting with Japanese PM Fumio Kishida, who backed it up saying that Russia's action is not just a matter for Europe but Asia also.

383.title: Replacing Chahal is no mean feat: RCB spin bowling coach Sriram on Hasaranga
383.article_body: RCB spin bowling coach Sridharan Sriram said spinner Wanindu Hasaranga has handled the pressure and expectations brilliantly in the ongoing IPL season after being bought for ₹10.75 crore at the mega auction. "Replacing Yuzvendra Chahal at RCB is no mean feat...and to come and fill in his boots and be second on the [wicket-takers'] list is brilliant," he added.

384.title: SoftBank's Vision Fund reports record $26 billion loss
384.article_body: Japan's SoftBank Group reported a record $26.2 billion loss at its Vision Fund investment arm on Thursday. The group also reported a net loss of $13.2 billion for the financial year that ended March 31. This is reportedly its biggest full-year loss which followed a nearly $38.8 billion net profit in the previous fiscal year.

385.title: Pant should not even try doing what MS Dhoni does now: Ajay Jadeja
385.article_body: Ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said DC captain Rishabh Pant "should not" even try doing what MS Dhoni does currently, adding that Pant should do what Dhoni used to do at his age. "Pant is a young player but [it] feels like he's been made a senior statesman very early," stated Ajay. Dhoni's current strike rate in IPL 2022 is 139.31.

386.title: Pune ZP to develop its land on Sinhagad Fort for heritage purposes
386.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) has decided to develop the land it owns on the top of Sinhagad Fort to promote tourism and heritage activities at the monument. "We have asked private agencies to come forward and submit a development plan for the land," said Yuvraj Desai, Executive Engineer of Pune ZP. E-bus facility to reach monument was also launched recently.

387.title: He may have his reasons: Boney on Mahesh Babu's 'B'wood can't afford me' remark
387.article_body: During a recent media interaction, Telugu actor Mahesh Babu reportedly said that "Bollywood cannot afford" him. Reacting to the same, producer Boney Kapoor said, "I can't comment on this because I belong to both sides, Bollywood and South." "Also, Mahesh has the right to say whatever he feels...He may have his own reasons for saying this," Boney added.

388.title: Humsafar to expand doorstep diesel services to 200 more cities
388.article_body: Humsafar India, which delivers diesel at the doorstep, said on Thursday that it is planning to expand its services to 200 more cities in the current fiscal year. The startup added that it is looking to venture into e-mobile vehicle charging stations business and is negotiating with some companies. Currently, Humsafar offers services in about 100 cities across India.

389.title: Gyanvapi mosque survey to continue, submit report by May 17: UP court
389.article_body: The survey of Uttar Pradesh's Gyanvapi mosque will continue, a court said on Thursday. It further refused to remove Court Commissioner Ajay Mishra and directed the commission to submit a report by May 17. The survey was earlier ordered on a plea by five women to gain year-long access to prayers at a Hindu shrine in Gyanvapi-Kashi Vishwanath complex.

390.title: Drunk bouncer back from wedding fires in air in Mohali society, booked
390.article_body: A bouncer, Happy, was booked by Punjab Police after he fired gunshots in air in a society in Mohali on Thursday. Happy, along with his employers, had gone to attend a wedding in Ambala. Upon returning, Happy, who was drunk, fired twice in air. RWA official said that youngsters accompanying Happy apologised. However, Happy fired twice again and ran away.

391.title: These issues will break country: Sanjay Raut on Gyanvapi mosque case
391.article_body: Speaking about the Gyanvapi mosque case, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Thursday said all this is happening to gain political benefits and these issues will "break" the country. "After Ram temple, now peace is needed," Raut added. Earlier, Congress’ Pramod Tiwari said BJP is trying to turn the case into an Ayodhya-like issue so that they can politicise it.

392.title: 2 men rape woman at knifepoint, record act on phone camera in Mumbai
392.article_body: Two men allegedly raped a 19-year-old woman at knifepoint in Mumbai's Dharavi, according to a report. The victim was reportedly asleep when the accused entered her house. While one of the accused threatened the woman with a knife, the other filmed a video of the act on his phone camera. Meanwhile, police have registered a case and launched an investigation.

393.title: Parents thrash Delhi man for stalking, molesting their 13-yr-old daughter
393.article_body: Parents of a 13-year-old girl allegedly thrashed a 37-year-old man for stalking their daughter in Delhi. The minor had complained to her parents that the accused, Irfan Khan, was stalking her on her way to tuition. When her parents followed her on May 7 and saw Khan misbehaving with her, they along with others attacked him with stones and sticks.

394.title: Didn't understand what Mahesh meant by B'wood can't afford him: RGV
394.article_body: Reacting to actor Mahesh Babu's 'Bollywood can't afford me' remark, filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said, "I honestly didn't understand what he meant by Bollywood can't afford him." "Bollywood isn't a company. It's a label given by...media. An individual movie company...will ask you to do a film at a particular cost...how can he generalise Bollywood, I don't understand that," he added.

395.title: Ola Electric CMO Varun Dubey quits days after CTO's exit
395.article_body: Ola Electric's Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) Varun Dubey has resigned from the company citing personal reasons as the startup grapples with customer complaints and Ola e-scooter fires. The development comes days after Chief Technology Officer (CTO) Dinesh Radhakrishnan departed in a series of top-level exits at Ola. Arun Sirdeshmukh, head of Ola's used-car business Ola Cars, also quit recently.

396.title: Singer Adele shares pic of her new mansion said to be worth around ₹450 crore
396.article_body: Singer Adele and boyfriend Rich Paul have shared a picture of them standing outside what is thought to be the couple's first home together. The mansion, said to be worth $58 million (around ₹450 crore) was previously owned by Sylvester Stallone and is located in the Beverly Hills area of Los Angeles. "Time flies," wrote Adele while sharing the photo.

397.title: My father's entire battalion installed projector to watch my debut: MI spinner Kartikeya
397.article_body: MI's Kumar Kartikeya, who describes himself as a mystery spinner, revealed in a video for MI that his policeman father's entire battalion installed a projector to watch his IPL debut in Jhansi. Kartikeya added, "When I took my first wicket, everyone clapped for [my father] and hugged him. When he shared that video, that was an unparalleled feeling for me."

398.title: PM tears up as girl says she wants to be doctor because of visually challenged father
398.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was seen tearing up while speaking to a visually challenged man and his daughter who studies in Class 12 in Gujarat. Ayub Patel said his vision was affected after adverse reaction from an eye-drop. Patel's daughter said she wants to be a doctor because of her father's problem and broke down, following which PM Modi got emotional.

399.title: Can't finish semi-final at 1 am, play final next day: Djokovic backs Zverev
399.article_body: Reacting to Alexander Zverev criticising the ATP Tour for scheduling his Madrid Open final a day after his semi-final, Novak Djokovic said, "You can't finish your semi-final match at 1 am and play the final...next day." "I understand...they want to sell more tickets...but that can cause problems," added Djokovic. Zverev lost his Madrid Open final against Carlos Alcaraz.

400.title: Many Sri Lankans leave Colombo after curfew lifted temporarily
400.article_body: Hundreds of Sri Lankans crowded the main bus station of Colombo to leave the capital and return to their hometowns after the curfew was temporarily lifted till 2 pm on Thursday. The streets in the city mostly remained quiet with people going out only to get essential supplies. Notably, a shoot-on-sight order has been issued against rioters.
